Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: FactotumDellaCitta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and enjoyed it very much. Our room had a whirlpool tub and a fireplace - both of which functioned well. The bed was comfortable. We were surprised with complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries. The staff were uniformly courteous and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I just got back from a quick 2 night stay at The Hotel Nelligan to celebrate her birthday. It is a wonderful boutique hotel, great location to get around old Montreal. We stayed in a petite suite which was excellent. When we checked in we told then it was her birthday, and were pleasantly surprised to receive a card and treat delivered to our room. On our next trip to Montreal we will definitely consider staying here again. We also had dinner at DA EMMA one evening which was absolutely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Superzu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic in every way. The rooms are very well appointed and super clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is just around the corner from the Cathedral and the hotel bar is nice to hang out in. The room came with a complimentary glass of wine at the bar and a $25 discount on a massage, unfortunately I did not have time for the latter. Breakfast was not included in my room rate, and the buffet was $15. You can also order breakfast Ã  la carte. The buffet was high quality but not so varied. It did have fresh fruit, croissants and boiled eggs. All in all I definitely recommend this place if you are visiting Montreal on business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 19Yogagirl61
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Nelligan many times over the last few years. The staff is always top notch, the service is friendly and the facility is wonderful. The rooms are so cozy particularly those with the exposed brick and fireplace. We will definitely retunr.

Reviews.Title: “Well again thank you restorative Nelligan!”
Reviews.Author: Dobbycat
Reviews.Content: A beautiful thoughtful ,relaxing place to stay. My room was huge with a gorgeous view of the St.Lawrence. The service was amazing as was the food . after trekking all over damp and slushy Montreal, I could retire to my spacious room for a soak in the massive jacuzzi and turn my fireplace on with a flick of a switch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Dominique H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nelligan for a family wedding. Immediately upon our arrival we were greeted by a friendly and extremely helpful staff. Whether calling for the car, getting our luggage or sending wine glasses to the room, everything was done quickly and everyone was friendly and professional. The Hotel has a nice warm feeling with the exposed brick throughout the building, yet also brings a nice modern touch. We found the food to be excellent. We would definitely highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: trippytourist
Reviews.Content: This mini get away was a birthday present from me to my husband and I could not have chosen a better place for us to stay! From the moment we pulled our car up to the door we experienced nothing but the most helpful and friendly service from all of the staff at Hotel Nelligan. We were looking for a peaceful few nights with days spent meandering through Old Montreal and we definitely found just that! We stayed in a Superior Room with a king size bed that was, honestly, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The rooms are large, luxurious and beautiful with original exposed brick walls, lovely furniture and huge windows overlooking the cobble stoned streets of Rue Sainte Paul. Night time in Old Montreal means many club hoppers on the street below, which could get rather loud at times, but nothing that a little light music on the stereo could not dull out. Our bathroom came with an extra large whirl pool tub and spacious glassed in shower, both of which were lovely and a nice touch. We had our birthday dinner at the hotel's restaurant called Verses. While the food was really very tasty, we found our server to be a bit snobbish and seemed to be a bit put out that he was, in fact, our server. Other staff that delivered our food, etc., were far more kind and professional. We only had dinner at Verses the one time, largely because of this particular server, who never seemed to leave the restaurant. As we were being somewhat indulgent, we ordered breakfast to our room each morning and were wonderfully surprised by the quality and quantity received at such a reasonable price. We lucked out during our stay as the staff decided to open the terrace bar on the roof, as the weather turned so unseasonably warm and while it was certainly nice to sit and have a drink on the terrace, the location became quickly packed with line-ups for tables. The poor staff were running like crazy to keep up and having difficulty keeping supplies on stocked, so the service was really slow, although understandably so. If you are looking for a luxurious night or two away from the daily grind I would highly recommend you pamper yourself at the Hotel Nelligan in Old Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the old city with top notch service”
Reviews.Author: TheSupers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned last week from a three night stay at this wonderful hotel. We loved the location and the decor. The front desk staff is genuinely attentive and accommodating, going out of their way to exceed expectations. The concierge that was on staff (Moude) was absolutely delightful and highly knowledgeable about the city. She made several excellent restaurant recommendations and since my husband and I are foodies we were definitely able to appreciate them. We experienced a noise problem on our first morning due to garbage trucks that came by the window to pick up trash around 6:30am. We notified the front desk and were upgraded to a suite on the other side of the hotel where noise wasn't an issue. We had a great time in Montreal and vowed to return when the weather is warmer and when we do, we will certainly return to this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The old town of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: domtheirishman
Reviews.Content: The Nelligan is a boutique hotel situated close to the waterfront in the Vielle Ville of Montreal. Well designed public areas, with an atrium rising all the way to the top and a bar on the roof, add to the ambience and the rooms - particularly those with Baths are large and well appointed. The gym maybe a little small for energetic people ,but all in all a great hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, lousy food, non-existent Internet”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nelligan on a recent trip to Montreal -- I had heard very good things about the hotel but was disappointed during my stay. The Good: - Beautiful beautiful room -- really very charming with attention to detail, very cool decor and an old-school vibe. Really loved the feeling of walking in to that room every day. The Bad: - When I travel on business, a simple requirement is the ability to use WiFi access in my room. Failing that, the ability to hook my laptop up to the wired connection. Imagine my surprise when I check in, unpack, plug in my laptop and find that the WiFi code and service doesn't work. At all. I call the front desk a number of times, they tell me it is working fine. It isn't. They then send up two members of the housekeeping staff, neither of whom had a good command of English or French it would seem, to fix it. They basically fart around trying to plug a cord in to my laptop. Still nothing. This continued for 20 minutes. Still no service. Finally something happens and my Internet flickers to life. They leave. It konks out again. "No internet service available". I call the front desk who tell me it is working. No, it isn't. Guess who comes back? The housekeeping staff who walk in, speak to each other in Spanish, shrug and leave. Fail. The breakfast was gross. It was a tired looking continental breakfast that was way overpriced for what you got. "Come again" said the waiter. No thanks, I thought. Best part of my experience here was checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my high expectations”
Reviews.Author: odonnellwj
Reviews.Content: Before we got out of our car we were greeted by the porter who took our bags from the trunk - The front desk staff was friendly and professional - We were offered and accepted the 25 dollar upgrade for a mini suite with a fireplace - We were given 2 complimentary cocktails and the bar staff was great - they have a very nice continental breakfast or you can order off the menu - I would return here every chance I could

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Greg H
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nelligan in truly a gem, located in the Old Montreal section of the city. The staff members are attentive and accommodating, the rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable. The hotel offers a terrific bar area, the complementary cocktails are a nice touch too. The hotel is footsteps from some of the finest restaurants in the city, several museums, and of course the waterfront. My wife and I have already booked a Spring getaway weekend at the Hotel Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend get away! Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nyjets89
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went up to Montreal for the weekend and we loved this hotel. It was in a great location right in old Montreal. The rooms were clean and the electric fireplace added a nice touch. The front desk were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Montreal and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel.....anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Jump_Boogie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Montreal last summer and stayed here. The location was perfect, right in the heart of vieux Montreal, near everything. The room itself was outstanding - it had a great old world charm, exposed brick walls, etc. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Would also recommend the restaurant on the top floor. We really had a wonderful time here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; great service”
Reviews.Author: NC_Foodie_11
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel in old Montreal is perfect. Our room (petite suite) was spacious and clean with large bathroom. Our room faced the front of the hotel and never found the noise to be problem. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and quick to respond. We did not dine in the hotel restaurant since there are so many great little restaurants within a few blocks, but we did enjoy drinks in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Room 203”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for our reservation and were accommodated right away. The reception crew was very friendly and gave my husband and I 2 free drinks tickets for their bar :) They have a valet that parks your car underground for you out of the elements. That cost $25 extra. We were warned that we had come up on a popular weekend (there wee 2 festivals going on) and that our window faced Saint Paul st. and a bar. He said we could end up hearing merry makers late at night. The room was huge! It had a jetted bath, separate shower and an electric fireplace. The bed was very comfortable and there was wifi. Very clean. That evening upon our return from ice skating a maid came to our door and even gave us some bottled water and 2 chocolates :) The tub worked great and the bath products were nice. We could not hear the people in the rooms around us but there was some noise from the bar that night but we were so happy with our trip that it did not bother us although I can imagine it would bother some people. The only problem I had was the heat. We had our heat and fireplace turned off and it was still too hot. My husband does not like the heat so he did not sleep but did not complain.. I slept on and off with a light sheet. Our bill came to $354.68 for a drink at the bar that night, room charge of $259, parking, and $55 in taxes. No too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous ambience, welcoming, unique”
Reviews.Author: Cdngirl_68
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal several times a month on business, and have been exploring different boutique hotels (I'm not a chain girl!) to find that special something. When I walked into the Nelligan I knew I'd found it. Welcoming front desk staff (complimentary glass of wine), lovely brick walls and a very nice spacious room. I will be coming back and I'm sure this will become my go-to place.

Reviews.Title: “where to stay in old monteal”
Reviews.Author: Jane B
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Room was spacious with vintage exposed brick walls,contemporary bathroom,excellent toiletries. Staff polished and warm. I do not speak French but never encountered any problem or "attitude" . Dinner in the dining room fantastic with an excellent wine menu. Would highly recommend this boutique hotel .

Reviews.Title: “noisy heating system”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: The lobby/bar area is very nice, I did enjoy my glass of wine. But the main issue was that the heating system is very noisy. It sounds like they have a thermopump or something like that. It's very annoying, and tiring, to hear that all the time in your room. Also, even though I had a brick wall in my room, I could hear very well what was going on in the next room. Not very pleasant. The decoration was very nice and I understand that my room was a 'petite suite' so they probably really wanted to make it look like it has a living room area BUT I think there were too many pieces of furniture, it was just quite crowded. One more thing, and I never thought I would ever comment on that in all my life as I have never encountered that ever, at the hotel or in anyone's home, the toilet seat was extremely uncomfortable!!! It sounds silly, I agree, but I've just never sat on that kind of seat before! So beware of room 402. I think the actual toilet may be crooked which could explain the weird angle of the seat... I don't know... but very unpleasant. There is a nice stereo system in the room and it was on when I arrived, that's a nice touch. Staff was friendly but had trouble explaining the bill the following morning. I ordered breakfast. Very ordinary. Very expensive. And awful coffee. I don't normally complain much but for a room in a hotel that has high standards, it was disappointing. I can be very happy at a Holiday Inn because I know what to expect. In this case, I definitely expected more. Great chocolate on the pillow. Honest staff (I had left my wallet and my camera on the table, didn't get stolen). Of course, very nice location. But I won't go back. I think the St-Sulpice on the corner is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Lightning2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute, arriving new years eve so that might be why we got a smaller room towards the back of the hotel. Still is was comfortable, clean and in general it felt pretty authentic as hotels go. The good thing about the hotel is that you can walk straight onto the cobbled streets of old montrÃ©al. The staff on reception are very friendly and offer good recommendations should you need a suggestion on where to eat nearby or what to do!! We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant as it was new years eve and booked out but we had drinks by the bar and it was quite nice for a hotel bar. The lobby had a good vibe with not the clinical feel that can sometimes come from a hotel bar. There was some difficulty in that we were wrongly charged for drinks to our room after checking out but the hotel sorted it out promptly. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hideaway in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel that has ambiance that felt cozy. Staff was awesome, except for bar tender. Seemed annoyed we used free drink coupons. Concierge went the extra mile in helping us with reservations. Location is wonderful. Excellent room and accommodations. Noisy after bar folks on Saturday could be heard from the streets, but not a big problem. Could not pick a better spot to get to great food and great things to do. People all over were wonderful at switching to English after we butchered French to them. No attitude at all. Definitely stay at Hotel Nelligan!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Nelligan”
Reviews.Author: PeteB62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had another great visit in Old Montreal in December. his was our 2nd stay at the Hotel Nelligan. Gorgeous suite. Very cozy. The staff is always wonderful and the location is perfect for wandering the histroic district, shops, pubs and restaurants. We highly recommend the Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: matinmaya
Reviews.Content: great hotel. very nice reception staff, nice lounge area, complimentary drinks was a nice touch. room was spacious and so was bathroom with shower and double bath tub. Nice view from the 5th floor. The only problem I had was the noise from what i believe is the central heating system. Not sure if their thermopump or such was on the roof directly over us (being that we were on the top floor), but the noise was constant like being on a plane. Room #507. Would return to this place but would specify for silent room if possible.

Reviews.Title: “misleading”
Reviews.Author: lyndz002
Reviews.Content: The room and neighborhood was beautiful, but they make you feel quite out of place for not speaking French and take advantage of the tourist. Continental breakfast is $15 for a bowl of cereal and other cold items, but they make it seem as if it is included in your stay, and make no point to let you know otherwise. Would not recommmend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Hoksi
Reviews.Content: This was a find! The hotel staff was more than helpful,friendly and accomdating. The rooms are adorable and very clean. The only drawback to this hotel, is the restaurant. Although the food was good, the wait staff seemed to have a bad attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely all you could ask for and more!”
Reviews.Author: tjgilhen
Reviews.Content: Once again on the hunt for a new "romantic escape" my wife and I recently booked ourselves into thee Hotel Nelligan in Old Montreal. Everything we read about it indicated that we really couldn't go wrong and I'm happy to say that our experience more than lived up to our expectations. The Hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Old Montreal and is a lovey building. Entering the Hotel, we were greeted by a very warm inviting open lobby and equally warm staff at the reception counter. No put on smiles here. Both young women on duty at the time appeared genuinely happy to see us and offer whatever assistance we required. Our junior suite was was very tastfully decorated and complete with an electric fireplace, very comfortable king sized bed a reading corner. The bathroon was huge with a jacuzzi tub and a large shower. We immediately felt very much at home and wished we were staying longer than the two nights we had reserved. Sure enough our time passed by much too quickly and we were sad to leave. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as always = Hotel Nelligan”
Reviews.Author: torontocharlie
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get any better than The Hotel Nelligan. We just returned from a weekend in Montreal with another couple. We loved our stay. The Nelligan is the only hotel we would stay in. It is perfect in every way. Great location and the staff is wonderful. The food is fantastic, and great buffet and breakfast. The bed is the most comfortable I have ever slept in and very very clean. Maude, the concergie was a great help to us. She was wonderful. The Nelligan is truly heaven. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: doc g
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Nelligan Hotel was just splendid! We booked with the concierge Andreanne Bertrand through twitter, as I asked followers a good idea to have a romantic getaway. We arrived to Nelliganâ€™s January 7th around 2pm, we knew we were early but we were happy to know that our room was in fact ready. Service at the reception was great and employees were always smiling. The lobby is really nice and doesnâ€™t have the general feel of big hotels. We stayed in the Petite Suite, and the room was great, clean and spacious, we had a walk in shower, and a whirlpool. Room (and the hotel) are very well decorated, and have a warm feeling. We decided to eat at the Hotel Restaurant because we didnâ€™t want to go out in the cold; the restaurant, called Verses is directly attached to the lobby, and also has a nice look to it. The food was fantastic, a bit pricey, but great. Our waiter, Bertrand, chatted with us and was more than helpful, as the rest of the Hotel the one constant during our stay was service, we always received great service, and Bertrand was no different. The only negative is the noise from the outside, Old Montreal is a tourist hotspot, so its to be expected, we had drunk Italians yelling and singing and we could hear everything, but itâ€™s not really in the Hotels control. I will for sure return to Nelliganâ€™s Hotel, the service is awesome, its high class and is enjoyable in every way.

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: lumiere59
Reviews.Content: Escaped to Montreal for a couple of nights. My husband and I were delighted with the Hotel and the people in it. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful, exposed brick, fireplace and even a jacuzzi. Would definitely stay there again and we are VERY picky travelers. It is on the oldest street in Montreal, surrounded by alot of quaint and reasonable restaurants and bistros.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable Old Montreal hotel”
Reviews.Author: rejoyceWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: Fiance and I spent New Year's weekend in Montreal and the Hotel Nelligan. We were very happy with our choice. It was our first time in Montreal and chose to stay at the Nelligan based upon TripAdvisor reviews. The rooms are very quiet. Even on New Year's Eve, we couldn't hear any outside noise. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Good location about 2 blocks from Notre Dame basilica and and the shopping on St. Paul St. The Old Montreal area definitely looks and feels like a European city. It seem like we were in Canada. You'll enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Old Montreal with a modern twistâ€“nice with a few tweaks”
Reviews.Author: BOSTravelHound
Reviews.Content: The Nelligan Hotel located in heart of Old Montreal, balances the historic with the modern. It's W-esque style decor, soft lighting and music give it a modern vibe. The petite suite we stayed in had nice touches like a Neptune spa tub, rain shower, and fireplace (albeit a little oddly located under the TV). The room was sizable and comfortable. We really liked the rustic stone walls juxtaposed with modern accents. However our room showed some wear around the edgesâ€“the carpeting, towels & robes could use a little updating. We were also located in a part of the hotel that seemed like an addition. The hallway temperature in this section was significantly cooler than the main part of the hotel around the atrium. Just something to keep in mind during cold Montreal winters. And our room (222) overlooked the alley and hotel dumpsters, which made for a noisy wakeup call Monday morning. Despite these few things, I would recommend the hotel, perhaps with a different room. The staff was also incredibly nice and helpful with restaurant reservations and sightseeing advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: K_Powerball
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a petite suite at the Hotel Nelligan in early December. The location was terrific. The bathroom was really large and clean; the room itself was nicely appointed. We really enjoyed having the fireplace and the bed was really comfortable. From our room we were able to watch the Saturday night fireworks - very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a perfect hotel- 10 stars if I could!”
Reviews.Author: SPatel192
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for one night on New Year's Eve, and everything about this place was immaculate, from the conversations before our stay, to accommodating our early check in, to the greetings every time we walked in. The hotel itself is gorgeous, and we were in a petite suite that was spacious, luxurious and the perfect blend of modern and romantic. The location couldn't be better, as it's right on St. Paul street, just a stone's throw from the water and the charms of old Montreal. The staff was really incredible, and their excellent and attentive concierge Maude took impeccable care of us, including reserving us a table at an extraordinary restaurant (Cava at 5551 Avenue du Parc- (go there you won't be disappointed!)). She is the model of a perfect concierge. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. We look forward to returning to Montreal and staying here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: oates9
Reviews.Content: Our suite was wonderful, the staff always put us first, and the location can't be beat in Montreal. We would be delighted to return to the Hotel Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: debtodeb
Reviews.Content: We arrived the day after Christmas for a four night 40th anniversary trip. I chose the Hotel Nelligan for location and the great reviews and it didn't disappoint. We were offered and accepted the $25/night upgrade to a junior suite which is totally worth it (although we are wondering what it takes to get the complimentary upgrade other reviewers have mentioned...hmmmm) and opened the door to a spacious room with classical music playing and soft lighting. Ice was sent up promptly when requested, turn down was efficient, the robes were fluffy and generous and the bathroom a dream. Dinner at the restaurant the first night was almost a disappointment when we showed up at 7:30 pm to a 1/3 full dining room but were told that they were booked. Fortunately the host remembered that my husband had been at the host desk a couple hours earlier requesting to look at the menu and was NOT told he would need a reservation. They found us a table and the food was very good (though pricy). I strongly recommend that you let the very helpful concierge make your dinner reservations at any of the local restaurants. When we tried once on our own we were told the "kitchen was closed" and again observed another couple being told the same thing at a host stand when clearly there were tables available. Not sure what's up with that but we had no trouble when the front desk made our dinner reservations. All in all our stay was excellent - comparable to a very presitigious hotel in Chicago that we stayed in last year for our anniversary. We loved Old Montreal and loved the Hotel Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “Lives Up To Rep”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Hotel with very large sized rooms for a downtown hotel. The hotel is well located, and the front desk was very helpful and friendly. The valet was especially flexible in holding our car for us. Our room was very nice spacious, and with modern/sleek furnishings. The bathroom was a fantastic treat, with a whirpool bath and a rainfall shower that was special. The only downside were the furnishings were a touch woren with broken pieces missing in a few places. But it was minor. The lobby is excellent very welcoming, and has a lobby bar which is nice. I travel quite a bit and I believe that you would enjoy staying here. We would stay here again, the next time we are in "old town".

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: StevenBTravelling
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently and found this hotel to offer professional service. Right from when we entered to when we left. We've stayed at others in Old Montreal but we've found this to be the best in terms of service. We were too tired to have the complimentary wine one evening but upon checking out they realized this and offered if we would like a complimentary cappuccino instead. The housekeeping service was also very prompt when we requested anything additional. And they gave us a free upgrade to a suite so that made it a much better perception. The design of the hotel is very nice. One criticism would be the small gym, but hotels in Old Montreal don't all have gyms so it is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nellligan-A Poet's Walk in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: drdavenyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nelligan is nestled inside of Old Montreal in Quebec, Canada. We found this jewel on another website and we received considerable savings for booking a superior king room. After 45 minutes of driving around Old Montreal, thanks to a Google map malfunction, we finally just stopped and called the hotel and we were within a block of the target. Parking will be valet, unless you want to walk an incredible amount of time with all the narrow streets of Old Montreal with which to deal. Everything and every person at Hotel Nelligan has an old world charm, not found in chain hotels of late. Nothing was left unaccommodating. I left my iPad in the car and an attendant took me down to the car, chatting all the way about things to do in Old Montreal. We buried our car for 3 days and spent it walking around the neighborhood. Easy and fun to do, but wear solid shoe, the cobblestones are a bit rough in places. The room was rustic brick through out the hotel. A nice touch for a New Yorker. An exceptional touch was a dinner reservation at Verses, 514-788-4000, the internationally known restaurant at the hotel. We made a reservation on the early side since we were early after the 4 hour drive from the Catskills in New York. Roxanne said she would leave us a confirmation for 7:00. After a little walk and some moules frites and pate' we arrived back to find a hand-written confirmation under our door. Nice touch, Hotel Nelligan! Our dinner at Versus was long and comfy in the wide circular booth. The wine cellar was nicely done, encased in glass and visible throughout the restaurant. Do not expect New York City table rotation times, however. Pan-seared foie gras was a tad cool, but still succulent. A special cantelope soup was cold and refreshing. The braised rabbit with papardelle was enjoyed a second night, and after the first night we had to ask who Nelligan was, as huge Andy Warhol type colorful prints were everywhere in the hotel. Bold and quizzical. Nelligan was a francophone poet from Quebec and died in 1941. I have no clue what francophone poet is, I have to admit. We received two complimentary drinks on arrival and the 5th floor mezzanine is quite the party space! We enjoyed the quiet in the lobby bar, however the mezzanine has a nice view of the harbor upstairs. Do check it out. Spend some time walking Old Montreal to the Bonsecours Market, pick up a genuine Tilley Canadian hat, and enjoy the SPF 50 protection for the rest of the day. There are many galleries, and the Notre Dame Cathedral are well within walking distance. Visit the birthplace of Montreal(1642) at Place Royal, Many sidewalk cafe's line Saint-Paul Ouest, and it was pleasant and remindful of Paris in look/feel. Montreal was on the expensive side, even for New Yorker's. The exchange rate to USD is about 95 cents as of August, 2011, so not a great bargain destination. We had been talking about Montreal and after three days we would go back in a minute! Hotel Nelligan is modern design, has free Wi-Fi, and the only real negative was a strange bathtub that required a balancing act to keep both feet flat. Not designed for two, but manageable for one. Now I have to discover the poet Nelligan. -David Christofferson

Reviews.Title: “Back for another visit”
Reviews.Author: SGMCanada
Reviews.Content: Went down for another visit overnight. A perfect and delightful experience that will help put the finishing touches on Christmas. A great hotel in a perfect location. Nice friendly staff, and a nice touch is that your are greeted by name. Had a petit suite which includes, a fireplace, king sized bed, hugh bathroom with jacuzzi-type tub and exposed brick walls. Free Wi-Fi, however there was interference from something in the area, which made receiption not too good. My only disappointment is that you can hear the other jetted tubs late at night which is a bit of a turn off. Perhaps extra sound proofing is needed. I would return again as the location is ideal for Old Montreal and especially nice during the Christmas season.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Swivy
Reviews.Content: A perfect little gem in a beautiful part of the city. Lovely junior suite, good amenities, quiet and wonderful king size bed. The staff was friendly, helpful and totally professional. The kitchen seemed a bit overwhelmed when there was a large crowd to serve. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back! The place to be in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Bbear332
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel At least 5 times, twice with our children (3 under 8). The place is classy, clean, modern, fun and located in a great spot for walking around, old city and old Port are right there, tons of great restaurants, le Mechant Boeuf adjacent to the hotel is great! Room service food is spectacular, the roof top bar is great as well. Rooms are clean and spacious, fireplaces and classical music are relaxing. Mini bar snacks outrageous, so we have to hide from our children, but that's expected! This hotel is a great value and always has specials. Very kind accommodating. We will be back when the ice melts :)

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Allison S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very romantic and memorable anniversary trip to Hotel Nelligan. I found the staff very friendly and helpful with answering all of my questions regarding places to visit in Oldtown Montreal and the surrounding areas. Loved the room, bathroom was great and the location was the best. Hopefully, we will get back there soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: KenSouthlake_Texas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nelligan was average but not what was advertised. 3 stars at best. Very disappointed. Room: Petit Suite. Size - good. Carpet â€“ Terrible, Furniture â€“ OK, Lighting â€“ Poor. Bathroom â€“ Great. Staff: Front Desk â€“ Understaffed and no customer service. Did not know Montreal. Door â€“ Unfriendly. Housekeeping â€“ Very Good. Workout: Most machines broken. TV worked. Free water. Concierge: The worst. F- . Did not respond to pre-visit inquiry. Left at 5:00 on Friday night. Come On??? What is that about? No help at all on Saturday. Did not know the city. Verses Restaurant â€“ Outstanding. Service and food were perfect. Stay somewhere else and eat there.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie V
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Nelligan. The staff is friendly and efficient - our room nicely furnished and very comfortable, and the bathroom has a deep soaking tub. The location is terrific in the heart of Old Montreal and a block from the river front with plenty of restaurants, art galleries and shopping in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel on business. It was a very pleasant place to stay. We had a great breakfast at Verses restaurant. We loved the Nelligan Crepe, tasted wonderful! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Thank our servers Julien and Daniel . We enjoyed talking in Italian with the supervisor Alexandra. Great team! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning to visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: tash_nat_27
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel!!!! Amazing location in Old Montreal!!! Steps away from Notre Dame, and great shops!!! Highly recommend, can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely getaway in Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Fairmont5
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in Old Montreal at the Hotel Nelligan. We made a last minute decision to celebrate our anniversary and the staff were terrific. We encountered typical Montreal traffic and I got out of the car to walk the few blocks to the hotel to check in. The staff were so accommodating and offered to send out a valet to meet my husband to drive the car to the hotel. We have had lunch on the outdoor terrace in the summer and the views are stunning. The short visit was very relaxing and our only regret was that we did not eat dinner at the hotel restaurant. I made reservations to visit the RainSpa and they did not disappoint. Very enchanting stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Cool Location, NOT QUIET”
Reviews.Author: 47thanks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Nelligan recently to celebrate a birthday. When we booked the room we asked for something quiet. Unfortunately they don't seem to have anything that can be termed quiet. We had a suite on the 4th floor facing St Paul Street, but were downgraded to a basic room on the 2nd floor because it was supposed to be quiet. Unfortunately it wasn't. We went to bed around midnight we could hear cars going by on the cobblestone streets until 3:30am. There were also car horns (a very unusual thing for Montreal, it's not NYC) and people talking right outside the window. This was the hotel managers idea of a quiet room. I'm not suggesting you avoid this Hotel just expect a little action throughout the night. The rooms are modern, reasonably well appointed, and clean (very important). The service is very good. We ate at both restaurants, the gourmet French restaurant Verses, and the trendy, and packed, steak restaurant, MÃ©chant Boeuf Bar-Brasserie. Both were quite good. Overall a good experience, not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jerryfi64
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Neligan while on business in Montreal. The small boutique Hotel has a great European charm. In the heart of Old montreal just minutes from Ste Catherine and the shopping district, this hotel is very well situated. The rooms are quite large and the beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Greg_and_Jan_MS
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Montreal on business and had the pleasure of staying at the Nelligan for the second time. The small, boutique style of the hotel offers a nice break from the typical large chain business travel hotels. Even though the hotel has a small, cozy feel, however, the rooms are quite large and well decorated. The staff also does a great job of making you feel welcomed... I really enjoy arriving back at the room at the end of the day to find jazz music playing softly on the stereo and chocolates or a plate of cookies on the desk. If there were a glass of red wine waiting for me also, I may never leave. The hotel is in a great location with lots of shops and restaurants to choose from. Itâ€™s also easy to get out in the morning for a nice run along the St. Lawrence River. The only negative I have experienced with the Nelligan is that on my first trip my room was on the 3rd floor and faced out toward Saint Paul Street. There was a lot of noise from the bar/cafÃ© across the street and the traffic on the street. I have never been there over a weekend but I can only imagine it would be slightly worse. But even with that small drawback, I would highly recommend the Nelligan for anyone looking for a small, cozy hotel in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: pal L
Reviews.Content: The staff at Nelligan make the stay so worth it. They take such good care of you. The atmosphere is always incredible. Perfect location. Very romantic! I can't think of any other hotel where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: mhuet
Reviews.Content: Awesome staff, upgraded room for $25, huge jets bath tub, mini bar, welcome cocktail, apples trayâ€¦..and the list goes one ;) This is just an amazing hotel with amzing service. The room are beautiful and huge! I never slept that well in any other hotel. You can't ear a thing and the beds are heavenly. The decor and the poetry everywhere just add to the charm. It has been a truelly wonderful experience for me and I can't wait to go back again. I just hope they would open Nelligan hotels with the same signature in more cities :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: littlegiant10
Reviews.Content: We recently had a party of 8 traveling to Montreal for a 2 night stay before a bicycle trip in Vermont. This hotel had been recommended to us by our bicycle tour guide from Vermont. It was easy to make reservations by phone, not even using long a long distance phone call from the US. When we arrived the staff were very friendly and helpful. All the rooms we had contained King beds with very plush linens. The rooms had lots of character in decor. One wall of each room was authentic brick. The bathrooms were spacious and comfortable for 2 to get ready. If you went to the lobby with a question about the hotel amenities or directions or whatever, the staff appeared to be waiting your inquiry. There was complimentary coffee at the lobby level each morning. The location of this hotel is convenient to many restaurants, bars and shops for exploring old Montreal, We took the subway to hike Mount Royal which was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern-chic, boutique hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TFTtraveller
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Montreal could not have been more perfect, and this hotel played a major part. The location could not be more perfect, right in the middle of the romantic, historic old town. I made the prepaid booking through a vendor website about an hour before arriving. They were unable to locate the reservation, as the vendor I used had a more manual process than one would expect in this day and age. The front desk agent was very pleasant, apologized for the issue (even though it was not the hotel's fault), and gave me a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite for the confusion and delay. The issue was fixed before I checked out the next day, and I was only billed for the valet parking, which was a reasonable $25. They allowed me to keep my car in their garage after I had checked out without any additional charge. The courteous and efficient bell staff even took my bag to my car so we could go sightseeing. The room was much larger than I would have expected for such a location. It had a fireplace, a king sized bed, a two person Jacuzzi, and a beautiful view of the cobblestone streets. It was quiet, comfortable, clean, and elegant modern in decor. The front desk recommended a restaurant down the street which was obviously designed for tourists, but we had a lovely, romantic meal. I could not have been more pleased with my stay there. We loved Montreal, and will be going back soon. I know EXACTLY where we will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Serene!”
Reviews.Author: rrotunno
Reviews.Content: Being a guest at Hotel Nelligan was a truly lovely experience. From the prompt concierge service, to the friendly hotel bar staff, to the charming front desk employees... the Nelligan met my every need. It's decor, furniture, and overall "feel" was also one that would keep me coming back for me. You can't help but feel both calm and serene, while also feeling chic and first class. Amazing establishment. Hands down ...

Reviews.Title: “a great place to spend the night.”
Reviews.Author: Gardengirls50
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay a Nelligan's. The room was spacious and very comfortable. All staff was very friendly and helpful. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “QUAINT HOTEL IN OLD MONTREAL”
Reviews.Author: BOMAN3672
Reviews.Content: The Nelligan is a wonderful small hotel in Old Montreal. Outstanding service and great rooms. Must visit the lounge on the rooftop. so courteous and in the right place when needed. It very close to Notre Dame and on a busy but mostly pedestrian street. Area as a whole is not conducive to driving due to narrow streets. Valet parking is very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a gorgeous location,but no free parking”
Reviews.Author: cateche
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice,but mind that the parking is not free (they never say so when they take away your car)

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Montreal by far!”
Reviews.Author: oliveneens
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded which was a nice surprise upon arrival. Your staff was lovely and our overall experience was wonderful. This stay was my second time at your hotel and I would definitely continue to recommend it to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJ G
Reviews.Content: This is a very hip hotel with stylish guestrooms, nice bar area and a very decent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: psos
Reviews.Content: Spent a snowy weekend here in March. Not cheap, but worth the splurge as everythiung was wonderful. The room (one of the small suites with the giant tubs) was casual elegance - so much better than the impersonal chain (even high end ones) feel. Wood, brick, beautiful linens - and the radio turned to classical music on check in, jazz when we returned from dinner one night, local indy rock on returning home one afternoon. Front desk had great restaurant and club recommendations all within a short walk in lovely old Montreal. My favorite anecdote that shows how chic the staff is. My girlfriend wanted to go shopping and asked the front desk if they would recommend the underground mall area. I said (somewhat aside), that we wanted something more Soho than 5th avenue. The desk clerk retorted that the mall was Jersey, not 5th avenue. Workout room was a little small - but I did not really care that much.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey N
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference, as well as some additional time with my spouse. The location was great, right in Old Montreal, near the canal. Easy walk to metro, running/biking trails, bike rental stations, and of course all of the charm and fun of Old Montreal. The room was spacious and clean. I enjoy having music on, and really appreciated the actual JVC desktop system with real speakers--I had brought my own auxiliary cable and thus could plug in my phone or laptop. The front desk and concierge were always friendly and helpful. Dinner on their rooftop terrasse was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: Pegden
Reviews.Content: Great location, the petite suite (#322) is very spacious and quiet and had two large windows that open on the alley. Comfy suede sofa and chair, a fireplace and fridge. The bed was too firm for my taste but the linens were nice. Housekeeping was a bit of an issue. It was like there was no check list. We had to call each day for clean bathroom glasses and coffee. Staff would leave coffee cups and sugar, but no coffee. The floor wasn't swept during our stay, but our towels were changed twice a day. Got the 'save water card' on our pillow the last night. Too late. On our last morning I opened the drapes and a spot on the sofa caught my eye...yep...you guessed it. I was horrified. This is a small hotel but they do host conferences and weddings. Both were somehat of an issue as they clogged the small reception area and tied up the front desk quite a bit. Our limited contact with the desk was good, although the bottle of champagne I ordered from the concierge ahead of time never made it to our room. They sent up some chocolate covered strawberries and a warm bottle of water a few hours after we arrived. Nice, but not the same effect that I wanted for my husband's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHPMD
Reviews.Content: I just spent three wonderfully comfortable nights at Hotel Nelligan. The room was a good size--not huge but more than adequate--with a fireplace. the design is lovely, not corporate. Bathroom was large and spotless with a jacuzzi large enough for two. Staff at the front desk are great. Location right in old Montreal near countless restaurants and shops. Only problem: no coffee till 6:30.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Flipkid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently took our first trip to Montreal, and after much online and tour book research, decided to stay at the Hotel Nelligan. And are we glad we did! It is in the perfect location: Vieux-Montreal, right on Rue Saint-Paul. Just a few blocks from both Place Jacques Cartier and the waterfront, and within easy walking distance of a plethora of dining, shops and attractions. AND within easy walking distance of three different Metro stations (although Place D'Armes is the closest). Our room was a junior suite on the fifth floor, and it was amazing. VERY roomy, yet charming and cozy at the same time (the gas fireplace may have had something to do with that!). Even though the hotel's rooftop lounge/restaurant is also on the fifth floor, noise was not an issue due to the room's configuration (there was a small sort of anteroom between the door from the hall and the actual room space). The room had a fantastic view of the waterfront, and--as the weather was mild-- we had the windows open frequently. The room also overlooked a narrow alley, but that was no problem for us... it was actually kind of romantic. (Every morning a boulangerie truck would pull up below our window, delivering freshly-baked bread and pastries to the hotel restaurant; so every morning we were pleasantly awakened by the wonderfull aroma of fresh baked goods... fantastic!) Our room also had a jacuzzi tub; invaluable due to all of the walking and biking we did every day! There was also am ATM literally steps from our room; how convenient is THAT? The staff at the Hotel Nelligan was wonderful: warm and accomodating (and no one made fun of my terrible French). The concierge, Maud, was especially terrific. As I said, this was our first trip to Montreal, and Maud patiently answered all of our questions and always got us pointed in the right direction. I do have one very, very minor quibble. While this may have been the most comfortable hotel bed i have EVER slept in, the pillows were far too soft for my taste; I prefer much firmer pillows. My wife, however, thought they were just fine. Just thought I'd mention it. Our five days/four nights at the Hotel Nelligan was one of the best vacations we ever had. I highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very individual hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rogandrose C
Reviews.Content: Sadsly arrived on a Saturday & bioy was Montreal & the hotel very busy with weddings abounding the city, getting to our room was slow & we were left in the lobby for sioome time due the business of the hotel with a wedding reception, however upon reacxhing our room all was forgiven, really lovely, appointed so well & quiet. Reception / Consciege were really good & helpfull, restuarant meal was exceptional, if not quite expensive ( but this is a 4 star hotel in Montreal)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Alison S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the room (a Petite Suite) was a nice size with a great bathroom - large soaking tub and nice glass shower - and was nicely decorated. There was exposed brick in the bedroom and bathroom which gave it a nice vibe. The bed was comfortable. Everything about the hotel and the room were great, no complaints. You can't beat the location either. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nelligan”
Reviews.Author: fm11
Reviews.Content: Great location and our room was comfortable and clean. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Had breakfast at the hotel and our server, Paul Andre, was a delight to talk to. The only thing that took away from this hotel is that the carpets are a little worn and some areas stained. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but choose room carefully”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-Dublin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right in old Montreal. Very nice hotel and staff. I knew from other reviews that it would have some noise given it's location and with a room over the atrium bar. My room however was beside a lift entrance where tile is on the floor so there was more noise generated from that everytimr heels or suitcase wheels went over. Hotel should carpet the area or not use the room. Pricey hotel but you are paying for the location. Overall v nice just check the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TeddyDavis
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel by recommendations and were not disappointed. Hotel Nelligan is nicely located in old Montreal. The lobby and bar area are lovely, as is the rooftop. Our room was in the new section - a convoluted route to get there, up and down a few stairs, but nicely decorated and a very comfortable bed. The staff was friendly and helpful in all respects. Seemed a nice combination of business and vacation clientele. The breakfast buffet was varied and fresh. We had a good, not great dinner at Mechant Boeuf but did not eat at Verses. There were just too many good restaurants in Montreal from which to choose. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “How staff are the difference”
Reviews.Author: kevin_murphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Nelligan and from the check in to the welcome at the front door it was why this Hotel is what it is, we were looking for reservatins and there was 2 ladies on the desk who were so unbelievable that we booked a reservation at Da Emma and it was done by I think Maude in I mean 2 minutes, with a confirmation etc and then she booked us into La Queue De Cheval again the next night so efficient. we are in the Hotle business and we know the value of great staff, next to ours this is probably the best I have experienced , property was very nice with rooms spacious and clean, roof top restaurant bar very attractive, all in all a 5 star weekend, we will be back Kevin Murphy The Great George Hotel Charlottetwon PEI

Reviews.Title: “So Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: X10sion207
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a super memorable business trip to Montreal! We stayed at the Hotel Nelligan in Old Montreal and I have to say, everything was amazing, the STAFF, the room, the location, all so cool!! Thank you Hotel Nelligan, see you in February!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at Hotel Nelligan and Many Thanks to David from Restaurant Verses!”
Reviews.Author: Niki Y
Reviews.Content: What an incredible experience we had this summer at Hotel Nelligan and Restaurant Verses! It was the third time we stayed at hotel Nelligan and this time my husband and I brought my parents with us. We stayed for two nights and were upgraded to bigger rooms which were simply magnificent and wonderfully clean! We dined both nights at restaurant Verses and both nights we had the pleasure to have David literally WOW us with his excellent menu recommendations and splendind wine pairings. We will never forget the joy and laughter he brought with his impecable service to our table. You rarely see and experience that type of service and unforgettable dining experience and that being said, I have to also mention that we live in Manhattan and go out all the time. We all had an amazing time and we are already planning our next trip back to our favourite hotel and restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4558
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with our insane, wild small children in this elegant, European hotel. Staff were always exceptionally friendly and helpful, even though our kids were semi-annoying. The location was great, right off the pedestrian mall and next to the river, the continental breakfast included fresh croissants, 3 types of cheese, and local honey. The terrace bar on the roof was a lot of fun, and the indoor courtyard would have been relaxing for reading and dining if our kids had ever let us sit down. Would love to come back again w/o the kids so I could actually appreciate what the hotel has to offer. However, if you have kids, it's still a perfectly nice place to stay and as I said everyone made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Magnetic staff”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: Truly smart, honest and magnetic staff. They sincerely cared about my family enjoying our stay. Great location, near all the fine restaurants and attractions. Open minded and always focused on your needs. Stay there, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Special thanks to: Virginie ,Nathalia and Nancy! We may make this a yearly trip, because it was so much fun.The hotel is located in the perfect spot to walk to some wonderful restaurants and sights. Make sure that you get a Metro Pass, and really explore this city's neighborhoods. Don't miss the Marche Jean-Talon, for wonderful fresh fruit in season.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Sabina M
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nelligan is a small boutique hotel in the port area of Old Montreal. The rooms are very comfortable yet also very stylish - each one different from the others. Everyone we met was very helpful and so friendly. This quality makes the place somewhere you would love to come back to. The location on Rue St. Paul is perfect - for fine restaurants, shops, galleries and just walking along fun streets. The hotel's rooftop restaurant makes this the very best place for lunch, dinner or just drinks. And the food is outstanding. But it is the people who work the hotel that makes it a 5 star experience. We have reommended it to everyone and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel - Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Burt L
Reviews.Content: For me, this is the ONLY hotel to stay at in Montreal. The location is ideal - in Old Montreal, but slightly away from the most crowded tourist area. The facilities are warm and inviting. The bed the most comfortable you will ever rest in. The attached restaurant - Verses - offers one of the best meals in a city known for great food. The lobby bar, and rooftop bar, are hopping. But, for me, the most important is the staff. At every level, they go out of their way to make the stay a perfect one. The front desk staff is the warmest, friendliest, and most helpful that you will find at any hotel, anywhere. The restaurant staff, as well. The bellmen too. It really is the people at the Nelligan who make the complete experience so delightful. A short weekend feels like a real vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: notgoth007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in May, 2011, however when we return I definitely would come back to this hotel. The rooms are beautiful -- exposed brick, large bathroom, comfy bed. The staff was also extremely nice and always helpful. And the location is just fantastic! I can't add much more than what others have already said about Hotel Nelligan, but if you want to stay in a stylish, comfortable spot in Old Montreal, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in busy Old Town Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BijouxGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Nelligan for our last night in Montreal. I was looking forward to staying here based on the reviews and their website. I was not disappointed in the hotel itself but it is on the busiest street of Old Montreal so if you are looking for a quiet place this would not be it. Our room was very large and well appointed but we were on the 5th floor which is the same floor as the terrace bar and our room was next to the bathrooms for the terrace bar. So it was a bit noisy in our hall and the carpet looked a bit worn and was actually taped down. We ordered room service the next morning because we were leaving so early and our breakfast was delicious. The staff was very pleasant and overall it was a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - I'll definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Cobaw
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nelligan is located in a narrow, but busy street in the Old Port area. The rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean. Great turn down service - with complimentary chocolates and water left daily. Casual breakfast area - with a reasonable continental breakfast on offer. The hot options were very limited though. Nice restaurant, and a very popular bar on the 5th floor. There was also a nice steakhouse next door - but the music was so loud it was overbearing. Overall, it was a wonderful place to stay and I would not hesitate to come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: Ben84
Reviews.Content: The "Nelly" is a 4 star boutique hotel on bustling Rue St. Paul in old Montreal. The rooms are extremely modern and airy. You receive a free welcome drink in the lobby bar. The highlight of the hotel is the roof top patio. It seems people come from all over the City to this bar. On a Thursday or Friday night it is totally full by 5 PM. There are many restaurants all within a 10 minute walk. The most unusual one, though, is the Garde-Manger. You must leave your request for a reservation on the answering machine. The chef then decides at 4 PM whom he will allow to attend that night. We were one of the fortunate ones who were granted permission to eat at the bar at 9:30 PM!! Well worth it, though. The Nelligan is on the waterfront and therefore you can walk to the local cruise boats for a two hour lunceon tour on the St. Lawrence. I guarantee that once you stay at the Nelligan, you will be hooked. Mange bien!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob P
Reviews.Content: Wow! Great hotel! I had read some reviews before booking. Some were good and some weren't so good. But we can't all like the same things. For my part, I loved this hotel! Located right in the old port of montreal, close to so many attractions and good restaurants. The staff (especially Mathieu) was amazing at suggesting fun things to do and where to eat. Will be coming back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel - EVER.”
Reviews.Author: mandysmear
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Nelligan through Snique Away and it was beyond amazing. You know how when you see pictures on the websites of hotels, your room never looks like it, unless you get an upgraded room. Nope. This hotel was identical to the photos! We got there at about 7am (check in is probably closer to 3pm) due to taking the red-eye to Montreal. They let us check in at 8am when we arrived... we were just going to drop off our luggage and then go walk around and get some breakfast. Our room was ready and they let us check in at no charge. We were so thrilled! We showered and then went downstairs to enjoy breakfast in their little restaurant. Breakfast was so great! The lounge on the roof was also amazing!! We had a great time up there enjoying drinks. We also had drinks next door... I do believe it's part of the hotel Nelligan too. When I travel, we always try to stay with Sheratons and Fairmonts. But, I knew for Montreal I wanted it to be a boutique hotel. And I do not regret it one bit. Location is also fabulous. Five minute walk to the water. I could not have been more impressed with this hotel. I cannot WAIT to go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST in MTL !!!”
Reviews.Author: Marc-Andre B
Reviews.Content: Hi, the staff are amazing, first i was helped with the concierge to find out some dinner place and also take our 2 free wine glass at the bar, the terasse on top is absolutely great, with a nice crowd there. the bed was fine.. Not extremely smooth but it's good enough for a great sleep. the room are absolutely perfect, nothing's missing But what we prefered the most is the OLD Montreal, we went by walk everywhere, short distance from the l'Assomoir Notre-Dame wich is absolutely great for a drink, then near enough of the GARDE-MANGER & LE LOCAL restaurant, wich are perfect as well !! The staff make this hotel-boutique absolutely great place to go ! We been to every hotel in MONTREAL and all i can say this is one of my favorite !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Jaime F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The rooms are modern looking and they are very clean. The best part is the staff. All were very kind and extremely helpful. Nancy was a huge help! If you are looking to shop see her first she can recommend some great spots. When we return to Montreal we will be sure to stay at Nelligan again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyBeaver
Reviews.Content: We had booked two petite suites. Both were wonderful with excellent views of the river front and the south shore. The rooms are large and the furnishings seemed to be all new. The staff kept the rooms immaculate. Each night we returned to a turned down bed, low lighting and nice music. Such a nice touch. All the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. From a location point-of-view, you could not ask for more. You are right in the middle of Old Montreal and a short taxi or Metro ride elsewhere. Their rooftop patio is not to be missed. Great views from there as well. All in all, a great hotel. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “some hits and misses...”
Reviews.Author: celticmoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights this past week. Reserved a petite suite hoping it would be a suite, but on the smaller side. It turned out to be an unimpressive dim room with an balcony that looks down the centre of the building viewing other similar balconies. The carpet was ugly blue/black/grey, the furniture was of cheap quality, the magnified makeup mirror was installed upside down, and they're were dozens of dead bugs in the hanging light fixture over the bed...yuck! We just couldn't endure this ugly room and asked to be moved to another room. The new room was of a decent size and what we expected a petite suite to look like. It had no view and faced a vacant building, had nice exposed brick, a fireplace, but the desk furniture and other bits were of the same ilk as the original room. Who installs the lights in these bathrooms...again the lights on either side of the bathroom sink were DIM. Trust me Hotel Nelligan, ladies do not want to put makeup on in dim lights and your bedrooms and bathrooms are dim! Left our window open and we're awakened by the garbage pickup around 7:00 as we were at the back of the building on a laneway. Other than the garbage truck the room was a quiet room. The hotel terrace is lovely and we enjoyed drinks there one afternoon. However, ordered a bowl of nuts and were charged $11.00... basically for peanuts. Never been charged for nuts before and complained to the server, and Martin the manager came over to discuss the situation and removed the cost of the nuts. We were not given the food menu so that's why we were surprised when we were billed for the nuts. My husband and his business associate enjoyed a terrace lunch one afternoon. The next day we dined there again, and the chicken brochette I ordered were warmed up and the accompanying vegetables cold. This dish was not freshly prepared, and so I wasn't impressed, but at this point could not be bothered to complain again and left it. The breakfasts are $15.00 + tax per person and is continental or menu ordered. Both were very good. The breakfast staff were courteous and helpful. Had no desire to dine at Verses their restaurant after the poor lunch, so dined off premises. This hotel is located on a corner and when driving up you park the car across the road and the valet attendant drives it around the corner to an underground lot.. Seems awkward but worked out. The front desk staff were great. The hotel was fine enough, the staff helpful and courteous, but I'd have to think about whether or not I would want to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel in the old city”
Reviews.Author: hbl6
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Hotel Nelligan in Montreal's old port area. The hotel is perfectly located for tourists wanting to take in the life in the old port. The hotel is first rate... we had a lovely time and the staff was superb. I sent the following to the management of the hotel: "We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights 25-28 July and I want to express our thank you for a wonderful experience. We just loved the hotel. First, when we arrived the type of room we reserved was not available and we were upgraded to an even nicer room with a whirlpool bath for 2. The room was well appointed and very large. Second, the staff was very friendly and helpful and made our stay in Montreal a pleasure. Third, after we arrived home I realized I had left my Jacket, slacks and a shirt in the closet. I called the hotel and they arranged to have it sent to me in NYC. I received it today and am incredibly thankful to your staff for acting on it so promptly and arranging for Fed Ex to pick it up and deliver it to my home. Your hotel is outstanding. I plan on posting this on TripAdvisor."

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Comfortable, relaxing, best hotel on the oldest street in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: yvon521
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wil return to this lovely hotel. The staff is efficient, courteous, and genuinely nice a nd helpful. Nathlalia and Mathew provide very good information thruout our weekend in Montreal. Our room was spacious, comfortable and relaxing. The restaurant was so good, Our waiter Max gave us impeccable service! We sat back and enjoyed the remarkable meal. After dinner we enjoyed sitting on the verada that opens to Rue St Paul and people watched while we sipped on some wine. there is not another hotel that offers you that in Old Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Can't imagine staying anywhere else if we go back to Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelcleveland
Reviews.Content: Trendy, boutique hotel located in the old city. Great location. The rooms were comfortable and clean. One of the best values for the dollar ever. I would highly reccomend this place. The concierge and entire front desk staff were some of the nicest people with amazing customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Don't call ''911'' just call an escort for your night off”
Reviews.Author: Iam35
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel and won't ever go back again. This hotel is really noisy and has a lot of insects running everywhere. We tried the food at the Mechant Boeuf and all of the staff were rude to us. Unfortunately Montreal is a beautiful city but we definitely won't return at this hotel. How would you spent a night without having a continental breakfeast included with a two nights stay at 249.00$ per night? If you wanna call an escort for the night then this hotel is for you. Donâ€™t worth the risk our room smelled like steak odour.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: Terrylbowers
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to cirque de soleil, though totem was disappointing. Hotel Melligan is behind notre dame. Hotel is beautiful and petite suite was wonderful, great jacuzzi bath and hotel features blend of old brick/stone walls with modern amenities, textiles, etc. Service rating 4 due to repeated requests for additional rom coffee packets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: jslamster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nelligan for 3 nights and could not have had a better experience. The staff was pleasant and welcoming, the concierge was extremely helpful and the room was quiet and well appointed. My husband and I are seasoned travelers and I recommend this hotel without reservation. Although we rarely travel to Montreal, I would, without a doubt, return to the Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dee_ry_2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nelligan for 2 nights and we regretted not staying longer. Our room was amazing! The hotel was very clean, the staff was very helpful and the restaurnt was great. This is a hotel my husband and I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Love2Leave
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough nice things about this hotel. Rooms are charming and quaint. Gorgeous modern bathroom. Sink in comfy beds. No need to travel far to eat with wonderful restaurants in every category on the street.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTBUSMC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nelligan is ideally located for a tourist visit due to its location in the Vieux Porte area. Many restaurants, tourist "must see" spots and the Cirque du Soleil all within easy walking distance. The front desk staff and the concierge are first rate and made our stay so much more enjoyable than the usual vacation spot. The rooms are spacious and outfitted in a superior style. In room lighting is however quite dim and there were a couple of times I needed a flashlight to read something adequately. We would most certainly return to the Nelligan on any future visits to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Nelligan - a gem in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Greenlamplady
Reviews.Content: We usually stay uptown at Sofitel or similar, but had been in Nelligan's indoor bar a couple of times and promised ourselves we would stay at Nelligan the next trip to Montreal. We booked 2 rooms for ourselves and extended family. Everything about our stay was perfect, from check-in to check-out. We arrived by car at the height of rush hour, and the doorman immediately waved us over to the curb and had our luggage out and the car handed off to a valet in minutes. TIP: use valet parking. It only cost us an extra $25/nt and the car was obviously stored in an indoor garage as it was lovely and cool when returned to us, despite the heat wave. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a room with fireplace, jacuzzi and rainforest shower...all this for only $25/nt extra. The room was fantastic, with a large sitting area, good LG stereo and exposed brick walls. The King size bed was firm and very comfortable, with mounds of down pillows and down duvet...best sleep I have had in ages. The bedside alarm had a mount for ipods. The room was super clean and quiet, and the bathroom was wonderful. The housekeeping staff were always helpful. The concierge Maude made dinner reservations for us one evening at the St-James. When we arrived at the St-James, we were delighted when the waiter there presented each of us with a glass of sparkling wine courtesy of Maude from Nelligan!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to organize an event!”
Reviews.Author: GabyCongres
Reviews.Content: I organized an incentive trip for 20 people at this hotel from July 22nd-24th 2011 and it was my 5th time that I had to planned an event there and again from A to Z, it was a great success! Everyone is concerned when you have a group there and when you need a support, there is always someone to answer your needs! When you arrive at the hotel, the bellmen are there with a big smile and very welcoming. Front desk staff - Amazing Conferences and Groups services - Claudine Debois is always there and very professionnal Concierge: Maude know the city and services from A to Z F&B services: Paul one of the F&B managers is very creative and client focussed

Reviews.Title: “The perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: nnnesquire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was in Montreal on business. Our host in Montreal suggested the hotel and our meetings were held within the hotel. I simply could not have been more pleased. This hotel is located in a part of town called "Old Montreal." The name really says it all. It was quaint and felt so authentic to the French Canadian culture. The streets were narrow and cobblestone. The hotels and stores were all boutique style. One of the nicest surprises came upon entering the hotel. It is unassuming at the entrance but you walk into a grand environment. The staff was friendly and attentive despite my arrival after midnight. My room... it was breath taking. I reserved the petite suite and the bathroom was simply to die for with a rain shower and deep soaking tub. The sitting area in the room was appropriately spaced from the bedding area for guest. The bed was large with luxirous linen. The best part of the room was the architecture. The halls leading to the room were winding and not your usual closet hallway that you find in some hotels. The interior of the room had a great deal of stone and brick work which I loved. I am going to try and post pictures if I can figure out how to do that. I just couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel. A colleagued mentioned that he asked to be moved to the "back" of the hotel to avoid some of the noise from the streets. I was already in the back so I never noticed this. He was very pleased with how quickly he was accomodated. He was told to simply back his belongings and the next time he passed the front desk they gave him a new key and let him know that his stuff had been moved there. The location was perfect as you could see some of the best Montreal has to offer within short walking distance. There were nice eateries and dessert bars as well as a wide variety of art galleries and architectrual delights around every corner. I plan to return soon with my beau for a trip of leisure. Oh, as an aside, I do not speak french but that was not a problem at all. You will be initially greeted in French but the staff will always revert to the language you respond in.

Reviews.Title: “3 star not four star”
Reviews.Author: dbtgirl52
Reviews.Content: So....a friend recommended Hotel Nelligan so we decided to give it a try.. There were some ok things about it but some very not ok things Check in....awful Wouldn't you think the hotel would ask if it was your first visit... Nope...it was almost like we were rushed to get checked in.. also...we booked a petite suite...looked more like a regular room to us Upon looking at floor plan realized we were given the smallest room on the whole floor...wouldn't you think they would try to give a new guest mayby one of the "little bit bigger" room...!! Dirty shower..the bathroom was nice but clearly no time spent cleaning the grout on the tiles...for me this is huge.....bed was good.. After we got settled in we went up to the bar on the top floor.. nice outside area.....full of smokers...bad service...
