We stayed for a quick drink and left as we were going to see My Morning Jacket that evening...we needed a quick bit to eat so we went to the restaurant in the main lobby....waited like 10 min before anyone came over only to be told they didn't serve food in the bar....ugh Ok so we return from show around 11 and proceed to go to the bar on the top again..upon sitting down we were told it was "last call" and we needed to be out of there by midnight...well we order our quick drink only to look around at a packed house of people ordering bottles of champagne and another table getting shots etc....pretty sure these people were not getting rushed otta there!! Ok almost done and over this by now...we went to our room...went to sleep put card out for our so called continental breakfatst..in the morning it came right on time but it was cold terrible coffee...and your basic muffin.. Ok last but not least when we went to check out I apologized for not giving the server the voucher for the breakfast and the person said that was ok and she gave me a copy of the bill..low and behold we were waiting for our car out front of the hotel and i looked at bill and sure enough the breakfast had not been taken off so I had to go back and wait in line to have her correct that...I also asked about the welcome drink that we were going to use in the bar with "no service" and ask if she would just put it toward our drink at the bar on the top but I was told that that was not possible.....really 9.50 come on guys.. Anyway did have reservation here on the 28th of July again but needless to say I have now canceled it...In my opinion way better places to stay in Montreal... Sorry guys.... k

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel for a romantic getaway in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: VTBusinessMom
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that my husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Nelligan in Montreal for a romantic night away and we have loved it both times. It is in the Old Town part of Montreal on Rue St Paul near many great restaurants and tourist attractions with lots of great places to walk. The style is very simple and elegant and the rooms are lovely with exposed brick and great linens and comfortable beds. The staff has been courteous and helpful both times. We will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet our expectations”
Reviews.Author: lswwest
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to our stay at the Hotel Nelligan, but from the start were disappointed. The staff member who checked us in was not very friendly. There were other staff members who were more friendly, but it did not give us a very good impression of the hotel or Montreal. Our room was very dark and seemed very cramped. The bathroom was the best part of the room. The location of the hotel was wonderful and the rooftop bar was great. We would return to the rooftop bar, but look for a different hotel for our next stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a warm and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: gkolidas
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great - cruise terminal within walking distance as well as sightseeing cruises and tourist attractions. Everybody smiled and did everything possible to make us feel welcome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: WillyAA
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Nelligan Hotel during the Montreal Jazz Festival and the service, room appointments and attention to detail were outstanding. The entire staff was extremely courteous and focused on the customer experience. This is one of the true gems of Montreal, close to the Notre Dame Cathedral and all other attractions. Spacious bathroom, delightful bedding and outstanding food and beverage service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ndyia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation to Montreal â€“ and I must say, all the reviews posted on TripAdvisor were spot-on. Hotel Nelligan was small, elegant, & clean â€“ with perfect ambiance. The location could not be beatâ€¦located on Rue Saint Paul West, it was two blocks away from Notre Dame Basilica, and Saint Paul itself is a window shopperâ€™s dream! Saint Paul is also one block away from the port where you can find lots of outdoor cafes and ice-cream shops. There are two metro stops nearby if you are inclined to venture into Downtown â€“ otherwise a taxi to the Downtown core is Can 10$. And because Saint Paul is a major street, taxis zip by the hotel frequently at all hours. But this is about Nelligan â€“ the King Jr suite (#428) was well-located away from the hotel bar/courtyard (atrium) and the elevatorâ€¦ so noise was never a problem. The bathroom was spacious and kept sparkling by the housekeeping staff. One thing I found delightful â€“ even after putting out the â€˜do not disturbâ€™ sign a couple days, when we did roll out of bed to explore, the housekeeping staff still managed to change towels and do a light dusting by the time we returned (kudos to Nelligan for keeping a watchful eye on lazy guests!). Nelligan offers all the amenities of the larger chain hotels â€“ fluffy bathrobes and towels, spa, mini bar - but with a cozy boutique atmosphere. One caveat â€“ there is no ice machine availableâ€¦ but a simple call down to reception and a valet appears with ice bucket in tow. If you have an idle moment, Hotel Nelligan has an attached boutique in the lobby with elegant clothes and accessories â€“ at reasonable prices. A casual stroll around the neighborhood and youâ€™ll find art galleries, clothing boutiques and restaurants that suit any taste. I recommend Modavie â€“ on the corner of Saint Paul and Saint Laurent â€“ they have live jazz every night upstairs and the food is great! My one complaint about the Hotel Nelligan was the lighting. The mood lighting increased the overall ambiance of the room, but it was a struggle to apply make-upâ€¦even with all lights on and the drapes drawn during the day. There is a lighted magnifying mirror in the bathroom, but even that was not helpful. All in all â€“ I highly recommend Hotel Nelligan â€“ it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: DrewP5280
Reviews.Content: This is a marvelous property located centrally in the old part of Montreal, and all of the staff are very attentive without being fawning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: it27
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Nelligan. What makes it stand out: Staff who are really friendly and down to earth. They seem like they enjoy what they do. It is a family run hotel, and it shows. Every one takes pride in the work they do. The room was huge, bathroom was nice. I stay in hotels in NYC a lot. A couple of nice touches: free water with turning in the bed; the hotel staff put your items in your car; a music player in every room; free WIFI. The location is absolutely great too. If you want to be in Old Port in Montreal, it is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a weekend in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Pigeonherder
Reviews.Content: Loved this place...the staff is young, energetic and very helpful. The rooftop terrasse is fun and buzzing. The rooms are large and the bed is sooo comfortable. Our room had great windows opening to the street. And throughout there were hints of the building's historic character. I wish every hotel was like this.

Reviews.Title: “Must return and stay longer”
Reviews.Author: SGMCanada
Reviews.Content: What a delightful Boutique Hotel. Full of nooks and cranies and charm. Beautiful, relaxing and cocooned in luxury. A rooftop bar/bistro that has a lovely view of the harbour. Unforntuately supper was not good and had to be returned for further cooking. This was done and the meal was then much better. The hotel staff are very attentive and helpful. This is one of a group of three hotels owned by the Antonopoulos Family. The others are L'Hotel Place d'Armes and L'Auberge du Vieux Port. The Nelligan is close to the waterfront and IMAX and Metro. Must see locations during a visit are Notre Dame Basilica, Place Jacques Cartier, Montreal Science Centre (the children will love it) and Marche Bonsecours. Bonsecours (1847) is an indoor location with Quebec arts and crafts and sidewalk cafes. Many lovely articles to tempt one and all. Lots to see and do in the whole Old Montreal area. Park your car and start walking. Delightful. My room was spacious and beautiful laid out. Huge bathroom with a Jucuzzi type bathtub. Will return as this hotel grabbed my attention and my heart.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Farmerville
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Montreal before but knew we wanted to be in the old part of the city and that we were likely to linger in our rooms and in the public areas. This hotel was perfect on all counts. The rooms were very nice, the location is great for wandering --- just a bit off the most touristy stretch and the staff was unbelievable. The hotel and restaurant employees were, without fail, professional and a joy to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nelligan - AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: claramacca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Nelligan for our honeymoon and it was the most perfect place to stay. The staff were incredible, the hotel pristine, the restaurant was out of this world and the location was fantastic. I would go back without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels!”
Reviews.Author: wwkwok
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nelligan is a gem is nestled in Old Montreal. The most quaint and beautiful hotels to stay. Love the service, decor, rooms, atmosphere and location. From speaking with co-workers, each room has it's own character of architectural loveliness. Loved having classical playing in our room as they turned down our bed in the evening. Breakfast buffet is very good too! It's such a beautiful hotel (peaceful and cozy), you won't want to leave. Service was very good (staff is always smiling and helpful). Definitely recommend booking a room at the Nelligan. Centrally located, close to restaurants, shops and carriage rides along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hotel, location, and service!”
Reviews.Author: kikiva
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a perfect location. Our room was very big, something I did not expect in the old section of Montreal and the bathroom was luxurious. The service was consistently superb and we were able to check in early on the Sunday of Grand Prix race weekend, which was great! I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, convenient, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: videohb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights while we were attending a large conference at the Palais des congrÃ¨s de MontrÃ©al. The location was quite convenient, just a 12-15 minute walk to the convention center. I made my reservation through American Express Travel, they offered a discounted price that turned out to be cheaper than staying in the official hotels associated with the conference. Our reservation was for the room type: "Loft Suite with 1 King Bed." The hotel staff was very courteous and made great recommendations for restaurants. The building is old, like historic, but internally has been redone. Our room was quite big.. the decor was very stylish and the wall had this cool exposed brick. Our room overlooked the tiny street. Generally it was quiet in our 5 days there..but one night there was a loud party in the bar across the street and we could hear it -- but otherwise no major noise issues. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very roomy, clean, stylish and sleek. One MAJOR plus to this hotel -- Free Wifi! Finally, a high end hotel that includes wireless internet in their complimentary service. The neighborhood is great. Really gives you a feel for the unique place that Old Montreal is. Every morning we walked up the street to our favorite restaurant we discovered there "Olive et Gourmando"... great breakfast and lunch items on their menu. When we walked to the convention center, we passed by the beautiful Notre Dame cathedral on the way. We would catch the Metro from the convention center whenever we needed to take the subway to other parts of Montreal. Overall it was a great stay. We turned a business trip (for the convention) into a little romantic vacation and experienced the beauty and culture of Montreal at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Tuchka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful boutique hotel with our friends from overseas over a weekend. The location is perfect if you would like to explore the old city. Restaurants, galleries, Old Port, shops are all within walking distance. Try the nearby Bocata or Barroco restaurants to make your Montreal experience truly perfect. The interior is stylish with a modern urban twist and very well maintained. The staff is very friendly and eager to help with every question or request. Little note: breakfast selection was quite limited, and in my view should include more egg courses. Overall, an excellent place to feel Montreal's charm.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Jos16
Reviews.Content: The service and quality of this hotel was amazing! The staff at the front desk recommended we go the the Terrace for a drink. We sure were glad we listened. We had so much fun and drinks were amazing. You have to try the house Sangria. Yummy!!! The terrrace is just beautiful and we chatted with alot of people. There was a big wedding cocktail while we were there and we still had great service and they made us feel important. Hats off to Paul!!! We will most definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: carorab
Reviews.Content: We arrived late for a dinner rez at Montreal premier restaurant so we went straight there, parked next door in a well lit parking lot and had a wonderful meal. Came out, our car window was smashed and all our stuff stolen. We went to the hotel and from here on our story gets better. The staff at the nelligan were so sympathetic, and offered to do whatever we needed. We had booked a suite but I had nor realized that there was one bed and there were 4of us (here for my daughters grad from McGill). They sweetly gave us another room at no charge immediately feeling so badly for us. The next morning, the general manager made a point of finding us and expressing her concern. None of our troubles were on hotel property so I was impressed by all the staff showing concern. She then had someone seal up our broken window, vacuum out all the broken glass, and make sure our bags were tended to while we were at our daughters graduation ceremony. They were professional, courteous, concerned and exceptionally helpful. To top it off we were there on a significantly cheap rate and we were treated as if we were the most important visitor. We have stayed there before and will tell everyone to stay there if they care about being treated as if they are their most important client. Thank you to Virginie (general manager) and all the staff on June 1 and 2, 2011. You deserve a raise!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: JKHart
Reviews.Content: We had a king room over Memorial Day weekend. The room was great, especially the bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and separate glass shower with a rain shower-head. The bed was not very comfortable and my husband woke up with a stiff back each morning. We had a street-side room and it was pretty noisy on the Friday night. There seemed to be a lot of loud people out in the street until 2-3am. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. My only complaint was the lack of information given at check-in; such as, the price for valet parking and that there was a free continental breakfast. We ordered the continental room-service our first morning and ended up spending about $20 on what we could have had for free! If we come back to Montreal, we would be willing to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Campaspediva
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. The rooms are fantastic. the only faults I have with them are that there is no luggage stand so my suitcase has to be on the floor. The mini bar is not restocked so it just goes down as you consume it. They obviously don't realise that if you had one thing one night you may want it again the next night and the things that you don't consume are because you don't like them. Another fault is the pillows. Far too soft and don't hold their shape. Stiff neck every morning. Also the weekends are noisy with one wedding after another. Other than that the rooms are beautiful. Staff are great. Wonderful location. Great restaurant. Nice breakfast but can be a bit slow if you want a cooked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - the best I've stayed at in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: CANDVD
Reviews.Content: My one night stay at the Nelligan was fantastic. I had a corner room with an awesome and comfortable king bed. Lots of room in the room (desk, sofa, side table and chair), and a good sized bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. Location can't be beat (short walk to the metro - 5 min), centre of Old Montreal. The lobby bar closed at 10pm, which I found odd (pretty early), but the restaurant has a bar area and they were open. I was at a two day off-site held at the hotel and the food served was very good as well - not spectacular, but good. Some others I travelled with noted that rooms on the street side of the hotel was a little noisy (with windows open).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: supersurg
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in a beautiful city. Totally clean, comfortable, great location. Hope to stay there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Old Montreal, close to restaurants and bars. The rooms are big, nicely decorated and modern, with all the amenities and free wi-fi. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Good breakfast buffet. Valet parking available.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: altadore
Reviews.Content: As world travellers, we are extremely discerning about hotels, and have no tolerance for shabby customer service. Well, Hotel Nelligan is the gold standard.in every way. Valet parking, with in-and-out privileges in Old Montreal where parking is impossible to findl Nobody pushes for a tip. Extremely polite bilingual staff - young, energetic and well trained. They cheerfully stored my leftover take-out food in the hotel refrigerator. Free crunchy apples in the reception area, quick check-in, fast elevators, and very charming soundproof rooms with original stone walls. Heavenly beds. A little noise from the street below, but being in the heart of Old Montreal was worth it. Two days after check-out I could not find my cell phone plug-in, and phoned to ask if I had left it in the room. Nice young man said he would investigate, and call me back. Which he did two hours later - even though I had since discovered it at home in the meantime. Above and beyond customer service. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yakster007
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out the service was the best of any hotel we have ever stayed in. Attentive to every need and not intrusive at all. Rooms are very clean, well appointed and comfortable. Great location in the heart of Old Montreal. Only drawback and this is not the hotel's fault, if you stay on a weekend DO NOT stay in a room facing the front on rue St. Paul. There is a nightclub right across the street and it can get very noisy when it closes at 3am. We had to move rooms after our first night and the staff could not do enough for us. They seem to be aware of this issue and i don't think we are the first people to have to be moved. Other then this, fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Abslolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lucymcgil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! Great location, beautiful room with a fire place, scrumptious bedding, luxury bath, friendly staff, just fabulous! Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding and pleasent customer service ( as my 10 year old said epic)”
Reviews.Author: eaglerockdesign
Reviews.Content: wonderful staff. needed directions a 3 am called the hotel and daniel was more then willing to help with directions. and a lady by the name of cindy at the front desk was so pleasent and always helpful. we are planning on going back this fall.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WackyTorontian
Reviews.Content: Checked into this relatively expensive boutique hotel in old montreal. Unfortunately, after a long day, we found out that there was no water in the sink,ub and no water at all in the shower. . Management was reluctant to do much about it save to move us to a slighly inferior room. We'll probably be moving tosoewere better tomorrow. This place looks greta but doesn't work in the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience all around”
Reviews.Author: booklover65
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for our spring break from University. We were able to take advantage of a stay two nights get a third free deal, which made the hotel affordable for two university students on a budget. We were also attracted to the hotel based on the reviews here - particularly that several of them had replies from the hotel management. That the hotel is willing to publicly respond to the complaints of their customers, however minor, is a big selling feature!! Our room was large and elegant, with wonderfully comfortable mattresses, a radio that was playing light jazz when we entered the room, and surprisingly good lighting for a hotel room. It was a wonderful place to relax and take a break from the bitter February cold. The hotel is a converted library and named after a poet, and has some lovely references to this history scattered throughout the names of the floors, restaurants, and decorative elements. The hotel is exceptionally clean with wonderful service from all we encountered. The staff at the front desk were knowledgeable about the area and able to recommend restaurants, and even looked up the location of the nearest RBC for us. Our only complaint from the experience was with the continental breakfast. We had mistakenly believed it was included, as it is listed as complementary in the CAA handbook - perhaps this is only if you book through CAA. The breakfast was nice, but not enough to be worth the $15 each we paid. If we had asked the price before hand (as we should have), we would have had breakfast at one of the many other cafes nearby. Overall it was a wonderful experience, and we would both recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: 227RV
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms. Some rooms have views to the outside, but the views are of other buildings in this old part of the city. Other rooms open into a central interior courtyard. The staff was a pleasure to deal with. Restaurant staff seemed inexperienced and uncomfortable with their jobs, but I only was in the restaurant for breakfast (a continental layout of pastries) and for after dinner drinks with colleagues. I would appreciate having coffee in the lobby by 4 AM for early risers.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Canadoc
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad place to stay. It isn't the best but I would definitely stay again. The atrium views are really just a view of a glass roof below, stone walls and tiny metal balconies. I can't really see much value in standing on the porch to look at windows and stone. Probably best to think about it like an inside cabin on a cruise ship. The room itself was very nice though. Very well appointed. Cumfy bed. Lovely chair and stool. Nice furniture. Lovely bathroom but only a shower. TV nice. Could be a better stocked mini fridge but at least there was one. I would have expected a coffee maker and there certainly is room on the desk. Staff were fine. Food was great. Location is good for visiting old Montreal. Not sure where you would park if you had a car. If you have time take a horse carriage ride. $48 for 30 minutes and $80 for an hour. I went for an hour.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: 12345Worldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our review is based on a 10-day stay. The day starts with a very good breakfast buffet and a Breakfast Team that is a ray of sunshine. The food we had for room service was made in the same kitchen of oner of the best restaurants in the city. The onion soup gratinee was the best I've eaten. Reception is very helpful, providing outstanding service and great guidance for restaurants, patisseries, and local sights. Housekeeping, room service, and maintenance were excellent. The valet was courteous and friendly. As with any location a couple of situations came up. As soon as they were reported to the Manager on Duty, they were resolved--resolved so well that service across the board improved to a level that one would think that they were at one of the top-rated hotels in the world. Paul and Andrianne are credited with this amazing feat. When I met the hotel's Director General, he said he was unaware of the situations and went on to say he was very pleased with what I told him because he wanted his staff to take initiative. The hotel had a special event, a Terasse du Sucre (Sugar Shack)--it was maple syrup season, while we were there. Paul and his team put on an outstanding event with delicious food and very good local entertainment. We became close with several of the staff and we felt we were home away from home. We would definitely stay again at Hotel Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bcarru
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this hotel in 3 years. We stopped here overnight from a business/ski trip to Quebec City. The physical atmosphere has not changed and provide a comfortable feeling. However, all of the staff we encountered have forgotten who they work for...the customer. After checking into our room, the noise coming from above our room sounded like there was major construction going on. After inquiring we were told of an event happening two floor up at the Terrace. Thinking joining in our resolve this issue, found a really young crowd and lots of cigarette smoke...not nice...and left to go to the bar on the main floor. The servers there had little knowledge of the drink offering and their service very poor. The men at the door preferred to stay inside the first set of doors rather that assist with checking in and checking out. Opening the door seemed to be all that was in their job description. Overall...we will find other accommodations in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheranda1966
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to write a quick note to say this hotel was wonderful. The staff very friendly, and the room was beautiful. Very nice hotel. Very intimate, and romantic, a perfect get a way weekend spot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: vterminello
Reviews.Content: Great location. Excellent service. Beautiful, spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel- Highly reccomended!!”
Reviews.Author: NT2008
Reviews.Content: As frequent travelers to Montreal, Hotel Nelligan has been the most charming place my husband and I have stayed at. The hotel is in the heart of Old Port Montreal and is walking distance from many art galleries, restaurants and cafes. The hotel itself is very well kept and the staff is exceptionally friendly (you rarely find this quality of service anymore). We ate a great dinner at Verses Bar next door, which was full to capacity and buzzing with people â€“ definitely a hot spot! Weâ€™d highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Montreal and hope to go back there ourselves in the summer, where we can check out their famous roof-top patio. Nadine

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Montreal Style......”
Reviews.Author: Eyyelash
Reviews.Content: Well , let me start by saying that the Nelligan has always been our fave in Montreal and the location and quality of accommodation which we always get really cannot be beat!!! My hubby bought me the Via 1 tics and the four nights at the Nelligan over NYE as part of my Christmas present. It was for the most part amazing although we did notice that certain things fell a little short of the last visit. The usual welcome by the concierge was non existent as there was no one by the front door when we arrived. The morning breakfast really started to wrap up early and by 10:15 am you were hard pressed to find the items which normally would be there for your enjoyment. We had to keep asking for coffee , something which did not occur in the past when we used to help ourselves to our beverages. In fairness, we have been going to the Nelligan for years and years and certain things DO change but we are not big fans of things you pay for just not being available. Now New Year's day will always pose supply challenges but the young crew working on that day were clearly undermotivated and actually turned customers away telling them that they were "sold out" of items which we had just seen them put away. Unfortunate really when substandard employees cost you future business. We enjoyed our stay and the aforementioned critique only serves to identify shortcomings to the hotel staff who hopefully monitor this site. Otherwise, special touches such as the "special cookies" being sent to our room as a perk were truly appreciated. We WILL be back.....no doubt as you are still our favourite establishment in Montreal!! A little polish is all that has faded and needs to be addressed! Thanks for an amazing Nouvel An! A la prochaine.....

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and decadent rooms”
Reviews.Author: AdamSargon
Reviews.Content: The Nelligan demonstrated excellent customer service from the moment we walked through the doors. Always a smile on the face of the staff, they went out of their way to accommodate our requests and went the extra mile even when they were not at fault. The room was fabulous (plush king size bed, faux electric fireplace, double jacuzzi tub, rain shower). My wife and I would highly recommend the Nelligan to all travelers that would like to stay in the Old Port of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience - old world charm in an avant-garde setting”
Reviews.Author: stratacon
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautifully appointed with lush chairs, fireplace and carpets. Front desk and concierge staff extremely courteous and gracious. Rooms are lovely - beds and bedding luxurious, flat screen TVs and Wi-Fi, plush towels and bathrobes.Located in the heart of Old Montreal. Contemporary hotel with an old-world feeling. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in charm and over-rated”
Reviews.Author: 2due
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Nelligan in a king â€˜Atrium Viewâ€™ room. We arrived there from the Westin; we were seeking a more personal and charming hotel experience. We did not find it at the Nelligan. Bad first impressions: on arrival, we were offered a room upgrade for $20 per night; we declined, expecting that the King room would meet our needs. We were also given two certificates for cocktails; the Nelligan defines cocktails as house wine, beer, water or soft drink. We thought this was chintzy, not to mention inaccurate. What we were not offered: assistance with our bags, even though there were two small sets of stairs on the way to our room. Did declining the upgrade, or booking a low rate through Tourisme Montreal, land us in the worst room in the house? We hope it was the worst room. â€œAtrium Viewâ€� is marketing speak for interior room with no view other than that of the neighbours. This room is not pictured on the website. Even with all lights on, it was incredibly dingy. It was overstuffed with furniture, adding to the cramped feeling. Opening the curtains was out of the question if privacy was desired; since there was so little natural light in the atrium it wouldnâ€™t have made much of a difference to the ambience. At night, the atrium is flood-lit. The bed was comfortable and the room adequately clean. We had a problem with the toilet that was quickly repaired; we didnâ€™t bother to report the drooping showerhead or the buzzing radio. We appreciated the free internet, included in our room rate. We went for â€˜cocktailsâ€™ at the bar, and the bartender was friendly. The waiter noticed that our table was littered with dishes from the previous occupants but did not return to clean them up during the 30 minutes we were there. On departure, we were asked about our stay; when we said â€˜just OKâ€™ they didnâ€™t bother to inquire about what they could have done to make it better, just sent us off with an â€˜au revoir.â€™ The Nelligan promotes itself as an elegant, charming and luxurious boutique hotel. In our opinion, the hotel is over-rated and the lacks all three of these advertised attributes. We received far better, and warmer, service from the Westin and far more elegant and luxurious accommodation at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Notre Dame Cathedral”
Reviews.Author: WarrenVtTraveler
Reviews.Content: We attended Handel's Messiah by the OSM on 12/13. The hotel was very convenient to Notre Dame. We found the staff exttremely helpful and it was very relaxing to stay there. We were very pleased with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, great location in Vieux MontrÃ©al”
Reviews.Author: witheachother
Reviews.Content: Looking for a romantic overnight stay in a lovely part of the old city, I reserved a king loft, which was spacious and comfortable, I received a CAA discount on the rate. There were no problems either checking in or out and the valet service was swift and efficient. I requested a coffee maker and it was in our room when we got there. We received a complimentary evening cocktail, which was fun to start off the evening. We would have liked to have our dinner at the in-house Versus restaurant as the menu looked delicious, but they were booked solid. I suggest reserving in advance, especially for weekends. We were not disappointed in the great filet mignon dinners we enjoyed at The Keg Steakhouse a few blocks away on rue St-Paul. We later returned to our room to find chocolates on our pillows and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a nice note, a sweet surprise from the Hotel for our special occasion stay. (Thank you Nelligan!) For the lows, I did find the bathroom and jacuzzi were basically only lightly wiped over and could use a good scrubbing. Also, a dimmer would be nice in the bathroom for a more romantic bath. I did bring along some tealite candles which were great around the tub. Unfortunately the toilet is really close, squeezed in between the tub and the wall. The glassed-in shower is huge and there is lots of hot water and pressure. There is a gas fireplace in the room that gives but a small pilot-light flame when clicked on with a remote. I was hoping for a bigger 'fire' to savor a glass of wine in front of. The king bed was amazing to say the least. Veeeerrrrry comfortable. There was a bit of noise from the streets below in the wee hours, but nothing that hindered our sleep. Access to the windows is cumbersome. There are very heavy blinds that need to be pulled all the way up to the top with mere 'strings' before you can open the windows. The blinds are fairly old and battered from all the attempts to open the windows. We attempted to use the CD player, but it did not play well. It was most likely very dirty and we removed our CD promptly and did not touch it again. The breakfast buffet was really good with something for everyone ... coffee, tea, juice, baked goods, bagels, cheeses & cold meats, fresh fruits, cereal and more. It's definitely worth the extra $10 per person/per day, but get there by 9am or so before choices start getting low. All in all, in spite of the mishaps, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not well maintained,service poor. Overpriced. Not a true 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Conseula
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the corner suite. Fireplace broken, night table lamps torn, carpet dirty. Buffet breakfast ran out of bagels and butter before it was over. Hotel and staff need renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: beachguy18
Reviews.Content: This hotel pampers you like no other. Great service, polite staff, great food. You name it, they have the best. The rooms were superbly decorated, very quiet and comfortable. Best sleep I ever had. I don't know what rating this hotel has been given, but I give it a 4,5 star rating. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great location”
Reviews.Author: cello42
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Montreal was potentially disrupted by an injury to my wife's ankle. The staff at the Neligan and especially the Concierge facilitated the medical assistance we needed, made appointments and arranged transport. They were so professional and helpful. All ended well but it could have very difficult for us seeking the the right treatment and navigating the medical system in a different country. Our stay otherwise was very pleasant, the location is perfect for tourists or business travelers. A good continental breakfast is included. Rooms are clean and well maintained. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Nelligan

Reviews.Title: “Nice Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Patuli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 322, a large sized room with a seating area which I re-arranged to give us more floor space. I wonder if they'll leave the new configuration. The bathtub was so relaxing after days of walking around the city - and the bath salts smelled wonderful. I loved having turn down service and the music they'd leave playing. No view from the room, and trash pick up was loud, but that's part of being in a city. We had a drink in the lobby on two occasions - very pleasant atmosphere to watch the comings and goings of people. The night we arrived we went to Mechant Boeuf Bar-Brasserie and having arrived late on a busy Saturday there was no problem in seating us. Our waiter, Chris, was friendly and professional and we had a divine dinner of oysters, foie gras, sea bass and the hangar steak. I would say we experienced great service from the staff. Especially because one day we noticed a big hole in the car bumper and when we called the hotel to tell them, initially I was told there was no manager available until the next day. I asked if a manager could call us that day, worried that we wouldn't hear back from anyone and anticipated a battle between us and the hotel. What happened was absolutely the pinnacle of amazing customer service; when my husband called, he was told the valet had mentioned something about the car and they'd like to have it fixed before we left. Wow. No argument? No denying responsibility? That gave me such peace of mind to enjoy the rest of our time at the hotel. The car was fixed and delivered as promised. Also, anytime we called for housekeeping for a luggage holder and a plunger (which you will need at this hotel for some reason) they arrived within minutes. The front desk staff provided maps of the city and gave a good recommendation for a late night Resto-Bar called L' Original. Slight negatives would be some small details in our room, exposed cords from lights, a piece of the drape not on the track and some dents in the wall where the chair has bumped up against it. Very small things in comparison to all the positives we experienced during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's a shame this hotel's service ruins an otherwise lovely hotel...”
Reviews.Author: devm635csi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over a busy weekend in Montreal when our usual hotel in Old Montreal was booked up with a wedding. This hotel's location is prime and the building itself is gorgeous with very charming, warmly decorated rooms. The common spaces are equally attractive. Only minor problem is the outdoor terrace lounge that, if your room is situated below, will thump bad american songs until closing (after midnight). The problem comes in with the service level at what appears to be a boutique luxury hotel - apparently all the reviews are true in that this hotel caters to business travellers and hosting conferences and it shows in their cold, sterile approach to guests. I don't think over the course of the 2 days did any of the staff even say hi in passing. Valets and doormen were indifferent. The front desk staff were too busy looking busy to deal with us. And to add insult to injury, housekeeping accidentally left one of our filled trash bags behind sitting on the chair in the room. Sloppy service and cold, impersonal attitudes ruined the experience for us. We'll stick to our standby when spending this kind of money on a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & charming, happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: mamafox
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I had a wonderful 4 day stay at Hotel Nelligan. The staff was consistently friendly and the concierge helpful. The look & feel were very attractive, with lots of exposed brick and new, stylish decor. The bed was among the most comfortable I've ever slept in at a hotel and the bathroom was modern and spacious, with a large shower and separate jacuzzi tub. The continental breakfast was more than adequate with friendly service and plenty to choose from (hard boiled eggs, cheeses, meats, yogurt, croissants, bagels, etc.). The hotel is well situated within walking distance of nearly everything in Vieux Montreal - - lots of restaurants, Notre Dame, Cartier Square - - and slightly far from the Metro (4 blocks, one of them hilly). The only negative things I could say is that parking is pricy but that's common across the board for hotels in Vieux Montreal. And I wish they had better soundproofing between rooms as our neighbors woke us up at 3:30am on a Tuesday. Overall I would definitely recommend Hotel Nelligan for a swanky, pampered experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RGGarrett
Reviews.Content: The hotel is attractive. It seemed careless, however, of the safety and convenience of its customers. It permitted a large video crew to film a music video on the floor I occupied for hours on the evening I arrived. The hotel allowed the crew to obstruct the hallway and room doors (including mine) with video equipment, and to string power cables down the floor in the hallway. Crew workers settled in the hallway, sitting (for example) on the floor in front of my room door. For residents of the hotel the result was troublesome and hazardous.

Reviews.Title: “only okay”
Reviews.Author: cookiepuss1
Reviews.Content: although we're not overly stuffy, i knew i was trouble when i walked into the lobby to be greeted by chairs with ripped cushions, a number of dirty coffee cups hanging around and most of the lobby being monopolized by some business meeting. Then in the room the cold water tap came off in my hand and there was a plethora of mildew in the shower. Although I think they just have different standards, i would expect more for a hotel with a four star rating. Definitely not the upscale boutique experience i was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel, 2 star service”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHR
Reviews.Content: Traveled here on business for two nights. The physical hotel is gorgeous, funky (and nice smelling) lobby...beautiful room with high ceiling, brick walls, very modern look, jacuzzi bathtub. The room has everything you could want except a coffee maker (which I would have appreciated) and a way to play your iPod on the mini stereo. It's a shame that the quality of the service doesn't match the amenities. The staff just don't have the right attitude...and don't hesitate to say "no" or ignore an opportunity to make a bad situation better. Case in point: I separately asked two of the staff members if they have the cord I could use to play my iPod on the mini stereo (the cord that sticks in to your iPod's headphone jack) and they both just said no. This is a $5 cord that they should have in every room...the stereo seems pointless otherwise. And if they were out of them for whatever reason...why not go get one? That's the kind of service I would expect from a $250/night boutique hotel. Second example...I went in to check out the breakfast buffet and a woman greeted me asking if I had my coupon. I said I remember seeing a coupon with my room key envelope but I didn't bring it. She asked if I could go back to my room and get it...so I did..up and down a few flights of stairs..and when I gave it to her...she said "sorry, wrong coupon...the buffet will be $17". I was so frustrated I mentioned this to the front desk on my way out and they just justified the situation without apologizing. The hotel could also do a better job of communicating the amenities...by looking at the one pamphlet they provide for room service, you would never know that there's a nice rooftop patio. I only found out about it by overhearing someone mention it in the lobby. If you go, just don't expect to be able to get decaf coffee after dinner there (or decent service)...here's what I heard when I asked for it..."you have to go to the lobby for that".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ISA51
Reviews.Content: Spent weekend with friends at Hotel Nelligan - great location and friendly helpful staff in general. Hotel is quirky and fun. Very busy and bustling on Saturday night. Stayed in King Bed room - the one with a couch in it - friend stayed in smaller King bed room). Good points: well located in Old Port - easy walk to water, lots of restaurants, galleries, friendly front desk staff for check in/check out, helpful concierge, very nice valet for car - parking reasonably priced for area. Corner king bed room was roomy and quiet, good amenities and pristine bedding, bathroom. Housekeeping staff were great because had lots of trouble closing window (my issue - not the window) and they closed it for me every time. Very easy to find when driving in and lots of room to hesitate with car when checking in. Need to work on points: breakfast buffet in restaurant was expensive and few options - not in actual restaurant but in bar/lounge area (not included in our rate), shower had trouble draining, bed needed new mattress, lobby bar staff (male) on Friday was not friendly - got a gruff we're closed at 10:30 pm, rooftop trendy fun bar means lots of trendy people in lobby, out front and in elevator on weekend nights - not really in keeping with guests staying at hotel, and after the concierge was gone for day - all restaurant recco's were only for the hotel restaurant. All in all seemed a great option in the area - maybe a bit pricey but it was high season and busy busy weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel; Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Brian186338
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about this hotel, having read a couple of reviews that suggested the staff were not as helpful as they might have been. We need not have worried. From the moment we were greeted by friendly and extremely helpful and efficient check-in staff to the time the porter put our bags in the car to the airport, we were very well looked after. The hotel itself is in the old town a little way away from the main commercial and financial district. This might be inconvenient if you are travelling on business. However on the plus side it is located in the narrow cobbled streets of old Montreal, just behand the magnificent Notre Dame Basillica, and close to about 20 bars and restaurants. The hotel itself is a converted old building. The conversion has been carried out to a high standard with a very impressive 5 storey atrium being the centre-piece immediately behind reception. This serves as a lounge bar and is where continental breakfast is served. We had reserved a Superior Room and were delighted with it. It was of good size, well furnished with a large comfortable bed. The bathroom was traditional in design but with very modern fittings and a good power-shower. The view of the adjoining shabbly building next door was not great, but it is a city hotel and not much time will be spent sitting looking out of the window. The house-keeping is really impressive. Towels were changed twice daily. The evening turn out included chocolates on the pillars, a quick tidy up and the room left in subdued lighting with classical music playing on the in-room sound system. Very relaxing when you returned from a hard evening a nearby restaurant! We had dinner in the bistro one evening. We found it a bit noisy with a Sports Bar feel. The food however was quite good and the service very good. We had a light lunch in the main restaurant on the day we left. The food was extremely good and the service impeccible. A further feature of the hotel is the rooftop bar. We used it on a sunny Sunday evening and it was fairly busy with the beautiful people of Montreal but it was lovely sitting having a couple of beers (courtesy of the hotel vouchers given to us on arrival) watching the river and the sunset. In summary we were very impressed and would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff we found to be very helpful in a very efficient way.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in great location in Vieux Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: onthego2009
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, modern and a bit dark. View--not good. No in-room coffee, no complimentary breakfast. Generally, front desk was very helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, no view, disappointing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 3rdimension
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable, attractive and well fitted out. It is also in a great location with easy walking to various excellent restaurants. The hotel restaurant itself was a bit disappointing and breakfast was even more disappointing, so basic.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy attitude”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyCouple
Reviews.Content: The problem with this hotel was the attitude of the staff. They were far too arrogant. Never a smile or a friendly word. When we arrived, it took the concierge 15 minutes to bring our suitcases up. No explanation or apology was given. Breakfast service was lousy. You had to beg for a second cup of coffee because the staff were too busy chatting. Our "Thank you's" were always met with a stony silence. One day they "forgot" to clean our room. And on arrival, we received a voucher for a welcome cocktail. When we presented the voucher at the bar, guess what? We were told it covered any drink up to CAD 10, and all the cocktails were CAD 12 and over. So our welcome cocktail became a welcome beer.....

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rupkg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Nelligan on 4 separate occassions over the last few years and it's officially my favorite Montreal hotel. It's brick exposed interior and rooms are comfortable and spacious. The location is in the heart of Old Montreal. It's surrounded by wonderful restaurants, wine bars, art galleries, the best Old Montreal has to offer. The hotel quests are quiet and sophisticated so no loud, drunk kids to deal with! The restaurant, Versus, is great. The best part of the stay is always the wonderful breakfast in the beautiful lounge area, great pastries and fresh fruits as well as the wine and cheese reception in the evening. The lobby and lounge are very cosy and stylishly furnished with deep leather banquettes and sofas and chairs. Overall, a very lovely hotel with attentive and helpful staff... one of the best parts of going to Montreal is staying at Hotel Nelliganl!

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Katiedog2
Reviews.Content: I found the previous reviews to be spot on; to include the few negative comments. Hotel Nelligan location and comfortable rooms are its best assets. The location is picture perfect everything you need in walking 5 â€“ 10 mins walking: restaurants, bars, wine shop, the Basilica, Lawrence River, bike rentals, souvenir shops, jazz festival. I found the room to be immaculately clean, bedding very comfortable, great turn-down service, and bellmen responded quickly to any room service request. The receptionists were pleasant and customer oriented. The rooftop bar was very trendy and had a great atmosphere. The specialty drinks were absolutely delicious, but of course expensive $10 - $14. The only negatives that I noticed, again that were stated in previous reviews is that lighting in the room is very dim and the restaurant service can be a little slow. But since I was aware of these flaws beforehand I wasnâ€™t bothered. I would definitely return as long as I could secure a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: Colin_the_Canuck
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Nelligan for Canada day as a treat to myself. The online booking process was simple and provided the option to add several web enhancements, i.e. fruit, spa, etc. -- extra charge of course. Check in was a breeze and I was provided with the password for the high speed wireless internet which was great and a free cocktail which I did not use. Room service wasn't too bad, but they made a mistake on my breakfast order -- I was too tired and hungry to argue. The room was fantastic. The back wall was made entirely of brick and appeared very stylish. There were two large windows that opened onto the adjoining alley. I had a great view of Habitat '67 which I didn't even notice until about 5 hours later. The bed was very comfortable and the bed linens were considerably nicer than the average fare. The bathroom was quite large and featured a stand up glass enclosed shower with a rain style shower head. There was also a separate 2 person jacuzzi tub. This was a short layover on the way to a concert in Toronto, so I didn't have a chance to explore the surrounding neighborhood, but it's evident that the hotel is close to anything you'd ever need for shopping, food or entertainment. I'll definitely need to spend a few more days and night the next time around... one day isn't enough. What I liked best about the hotel was the location and atmosphere. Old Montreal is definitely unique, and this hotel is in character with it's surroundings. What I liked least about the stay was the size of the room. I expected a bit larger sitting area as opposed to the single chair and 2 person table that were provided. The pictures and descriptions made me believe there would be a bit more room. All in all... a great place to stay. I'd have no qualms in recommending this hotel to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “stylish downtown hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: winst0n4
Reviews.Content: The Nelligan is beautifully situated a block from the St. Lawrence in a spectacular Victorian former business district. Rooms are comfortable, stylish, even elegant. Staff are courteous and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service, Ideal Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hk16
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for the Grand Prix and had a great time. Maude, the concierge is great and was a big help to our trip planning. The room was very nice and romantic. My only complaint is the lack of a view. We ate at two of the restaurants and the food was very good although pricey. Highly recommend visiting the upstairs terrace for a sunset cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: martula
Reviews.Content: The good: The Hotel Nelligan is well situated in the old city and close to nice restaurants and art galleries. The bad: the hotel staff is unfriendly, even cold, especially in the bar. When we went to have our "complimentary drink" we were told, after ordering, that our drinks weren't included in the "complimentary" category and that we'd have to pay. The waitress then proceeded to overcharge us and getting her to change it was impossible, since she never came back to us. We asked the front desk to change it and he told us that he "had nothing to do with the bar." When I said it was impossible to pay, he finally called over someone to help. The breakfast was adequate, with no refills on coffee unless you tracked down a waitress -- not an easy task. Our "beautiful room with separate sitting area" was cramped and dark, with no reading lamps and the sconce actually came out of the wall. The sitting area was a chair smashed into a desk that no one would ever be able to sit in. With Montreal filled with what seem like charming boutique hotels, I cannot imagine why Hotel Nelligan has gotten such good press. I would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to feel like your presence is a huge imposition on the staff.”
Reviews.Author: ditaNC
Reviews.Content: With taxes, one night 's stay came to $300. The room was described as having a sitting area (a corner with a chair jammed into it) and a romantic view (the building across the street). We had coupons for a "welcome cocktail", with the note that some premium brands were excluded. We ordered a glass of wine from the list and when we presented the coupons were told that the coupon was for a house wine only so basically we were stuck with it. We were billed $4 more than the listed amount. When we complained to the concierge about the coupon misunderstanding, he said he could do nothing about it since the bar was a separate entity. The room had 2 beds, only one with a gooseneck reading light. When I attempted to turn it to a useful angle, the light it was connected to came out of the wall. The continental breakfast was served in the bar- when we looked at the other room of the bar which had chafing dishes (empty) we were told, "that's not for you, you have to pay for that." A second cup of coffee was not offered. The ultimate insult was at our departure when, after watching us bump our suitcases down 5 (approx) steep steps to the street, the doorman (who had been watching) offered to wheel them across the street to our car!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Skip Room 501”
Reviews.Author: MIShopperGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel had lots of character, with great decor, excellent service, and wonderful rooms. The beds were soft and heavenly. The bathrooms were spacious with excellent amenities. The breakfast buffet was plentiful (eggs, fruit, a variety of breads, yogurt, etc.) You could not beat the location in Old Montreal because it was within walking distance of nearly everything we wanted to see. There were robes and an unbrella in every room. We loved the free internet in our room. The only thing that made us wish we had stayed somewhere else was that we were in room 501 which is next to the stairwell of the Verses Sky Terrace bar, so all evening long we had to listen to the music above our heads, the thumping of people walking up and down the stairs to the bar, and inebriated people talking loudly outside our room door while they waited for the elevator. It was unpleasant to say the least but since we were travelling with family we couldn't move to another hotel. If I had a choice, I wouldn't stay there again simply because of the location of our room in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, good location...”
Reviews.Author: ManleyLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location; front desk, breakfast, bellboy, staff very kind and helpful at all times. We had a good room with clean and nice bathroom, our room had no view it faced onto a back alley so it was very quiet - can't have both. The only problem with this hotel is housekeeping and what a problem! We had to ask and ask again for our room to be cleaned, maids just said it was not their problem and just to ring down to reception which we did every day. The 'turn down' is a joke they come so late, one evening they knocked and knocked at 10 pm, obviously we said 'no' but those with children just put to sleep would not be too pleased! If you can't get the rooms cleaned in the day why offer a turn down? I had an issue with a shard of glass found on the bathroom floor which I took to receiption and reported but had no feed back from the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Well, almost...”
Reviews.Author: gpsmyth
Reviews.Content: Our very high expectations were surpassed the minute we entered the lobby. They were prepared for our arrival at the front desk with room keys and registration forms pre-printed. All we had to do was sign and head straight to our room. The exposed brick decor was masculine and stylish. The radio was on when we entered our room and tuned to a classical music station, which set the tone. The beds were very comfortable and inviting. A nap was a must! The free Internet access and upscale bathroom design were welcome extras. My only complaint was the limited room service menu. I was told that they had the restaurant served cheese & fruit, but would not be able to deliver it to the room. Even the server admitted that was strange. I am accustomed to hearing "W"hatever. "W"henever, from my other favorite in-town hotel. I would return...with my own fruit and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Old town, large rooms, poor service - declining value for money”
Reviews.Author: BluMartini
Reviews.Content: I went to the Nelligan twice in 3 years - The attraction of the hotel is definitely declining. I felt staff was not professional or properly trained. It also felt there was a shortage of people working in the hotel: the doorman was absent on arrival & there was one receptionnist both answering several telephone calls while I was ready for check in after a long trip. shortage of smiles too in the hotel - Staff felt either tired, stressed or bored - The breakfast staff was not very friendly or too busy cleaning & setting up the room to care about the clients. The bedroom felt tired & dull, old technology in the rooms: needs updating with furniture tiring.

Reviews.Title: “The Nelligan was wonderful; Great rooms, OK service; Montreal can be hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: teambert
Reviews.Content: Ours was a lovely room, better than the pictures, really. The chief concern was that it was so nice my partner and I really didn't want to leave during our four night stay. The bathroom, as noted, is fantastic. The main room is well furnished and had artsy touches that my partner seemed to enjoy. The courtyard view is pleasant; I imagine a window to the outside, if one is available, would be much better. The bedding is very nice, the turn down service is spoiling, and I was pleased that the room is sufficiently dark (and quiet!) at night. And while it's neither here nor there, I'm amazed that Montreal has such a wonderful classical station; much better than what I'm used to stateside, and fantastic when getting ready to falling asleep. Location is superb. You're where you want to be, here. Most attractions are within walking distance. The complementary wine service is very nice. The wine, actually, isn't that bad. If you do decide on the Nelligan, it's worth cashing in your coupons. Service as far as our wine was pretty unfriendly; the bartender was interested in clients who were paying, which I understand, but rubbed me the wrong way as we were pleasant, well dressed, and borderline obnoxious tippers. Service at the front desk gets average marks. Check in was quick and painless. The valet was prompt, although I believe I only accessed my car once during the trip (forgot to take up with me the engagement ring I'd hidden, apparently from myself). When I asked for dining recommendations, or directions, I found the reception somewhat frosty and certainly unhelpful. Check out was similarly quick and painless. We didn't end up getting engaged here (although we did about a month later), as non-Nelligan parts of our trip were unexpectedly unfriendly. I think in part because we are young and obviously American tourists, our experiences may have been atypical. We were not well received when dining; conversing in English or French didn't seem to make a difference. Driving is somewhat frustrating and confusing, even with a passing knowledge of French (be warned that near everything is in French, and GPS is your friend; check if extra charges are associated with its use if American). After giving up on driving, we opted for a taxi, and our taxi driver after reciting Hail Mary's and Our Father's on his rosary proceeded to tailgate the car in front of us until at the next light things devolved into a shouting match with choice words my mother used only when very upset, a few lights following their passenger was spitting through the car windows on our driver and throwing her ice scraper (here I had to laugh), until at the next light there was a fist fight between our taxi driver and the two BMW occupants. I suppose the good news is that the police arrive quickly and taxi ride was free, but I didn't find the Quebecois in my limited experience to be very pleasant. My partner was also quite upset after the incident, which was going to be the night I popped the question. Our massages were quite good at Spa Diva, and I heartily recommend splurging, even better as a couples' treat. I have to say, albeit with limited experience, that was the best massage I've ever received. By the end I was ready to propose to the masseuse, not my now wife. All in all it was a good experience; I can't hold unstable taxi drivers against the Nelligan or give them credit for religion reaffirming masseuses. Overall I'd rate the Nelligan a four. The room itself is truly a five, but the service was at times cold and for the price and the much credited hype on TA, I admit I had expected a little more. Best wishes for your own adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Mtl57
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Nelligan quite a few times, this last visit did not disappoint. The staff were professional and very helpful from booking to check out. The rooms are impressive have cosy but trendy decor and are spotlessly clean. The bar and restaurant has a nice atmosphere that fits the old port vibe well. I travel often and have stayed in many hotels across Europe and N. America, and there is usually something that isn't up to standard even at the best hotels - this is one of the few where I couldn't think of how they could do it better.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels you could ever imagine!”
Reviews.Author: MercyS2
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Great location, friendly staff, well thought out room with everything you need, great bathrooms, modern design and furnishings throughout the hotel, very comfortable beddings, excellent restaurants, very reasonably priced - can't recommend this place enough. Would probably put it in my top 5 hotels that I have stayed at in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JenniferI1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern, clean and very tasteful with an upscale feel and a warm and cozy fireplace. The bathroom had a luxurious whirlpool with lovely bath products. The bar and restaurant are fantastic - nice to have great quality right downstairs. Concierge was fantastic via e-mail prior to my visit. Couldn't have asked for a better trip.

Reviews.Title: “All staff very helpful - ambiance, food, location - superb, really!”
Reviews.Author: papabravo1
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot - from first contact with a very pleasant valet to attentive front desk staff, all thoroughly bilingual, we were very pleased with this fine establishment; we'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: sharanne1118
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Old Montreal for a 4 day get-away. The hotel was beautiful. It is decorated in a trendy, urban chic dÃ©cor. It is very clean, and the staff was polite and helpful. My husband and I are frequent travelers; we look to stay in the nicest hotels available. There is curbside valet parking for all guests; and concierge service around the clock. We received complimentary wine every night on the roof top lounge, and a free truly continental breakfast daily with wonderful croissants, rich coffee, and fruit and chocolate. Old Montreal is decidedly European with most staff speaking multiple languages including English, French and Spanish. The hotel is located in the heart of Old Montreal and walking is a must. This hotel is located a block from the Note Dame Basilica, The historic waterfront, museums, shopping and restaurants. My one suggestion is not to stay on the top floor, as the rooftop bar and restaurant are noisy well past midnight, and the staff is up there cleaning and moving chairs and tables very early!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nelligan”
Reviews.Author: TreveP
Reviews.Content: In recent visit to Montreal to attend the IDF congress at the Palais Congress, stayed at the Nelligan in Old Montreal. Really enjoyed this hotel. Firstly, it was a great location- within walking distance of the Palais Congress (where the metro station is located as well). Room was great- spacious, tastefully decorated. Staff very efficient and friendly. Plently of restaurants within walking distance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and chic.”
Reviews.Author: PugPericles
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Old Montreal. Staff was friendly and most helpful with any special request. The morning breakfast buffet is really nice and much more than a continental breakfast. Rooms are a bit dark but ultra modern and comfortable. Free WIFI is a plus, too. Hotel is also near several excellent french restaurants. The concierge helped us with reservations and the meals were wonderful. The hotel also caters to groups with meeting rooms and other functions so it's a bit busier than the traditional boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy room”
Reviews.Author: CatViccer
Reviews.Content: Loved Hotel Nelligan! Boutique hotel in a great location in Old Montreal. Bed was super comfy, nice amenities, although the bathroom lighting was a little dark. Wine happy hour each night was nice, and Jean the concierge rocked! She really hooked us up at some great restaurants -- Restaurant Toque!, the Globe (for people-watching). Some people say it is noisy - but I thought it was super quiet, no problem with noise. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel that I would return to again and again.”
Reviews.Author: orchidnb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nelligan is located in the Old City of Montreal. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were elegant, comfortable and clean. I had a small issue with the location of the TV compared to the bed but it could certainly be overlooked. Morning breakfast was delicious and complementary evening wine and cheese was a delight. Highly recommended for couples, business or leisure. Not handicapped accessible but neither was anything else on the cobblestone streets of Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, excellent location in the old town”
Reviews.Author: Raquelos
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, really well put together. Downside was that the whirlpool bath didn't work and was't fixed while we were there despite highlighting it twice. We were offered a room change the second time, but it was our last night so we didn't bother. When we mentioned this at check out they offered to wave the phone charges on the room ($10) with abit more pushing they only charged us for a basic room which was fine, but should have been their first offer in my opinion. Other than that a lovely experience. The continental breakfast had everything you would expect and the bagels were particularly good. We ate at the restaurant and it was pretty nice, food and service wer excellent, we would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy247
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Nelligan. It was more than I expected! Everyone was friendly & more than helpful. It had a very warm ambiance & I felt so comfortable. We had a double room & it was very tastefully decorated. We were facing the street & there was never a problem with noise. The bathroom was spacious & the products were heavenly! I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An enchanting time in Old Montreal at the Hotel Nelligan”
Reviews.Author: gainbas
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a romantic hotel in Old Montreal (the historic center of the city) with a bit of boutique hipness and Euro style to it, Hotel Nelligan is a great choice. There's a reason why Hotel Nelligan consistently scores the highest marks on Trip Advisor and gets rave reviews in travel magazines -- every aspect of our stay was fantastic, from the romantic rooms to the sky terrace to the service. Best of all, the hotel is located on a cobblestone, very European-feeling street, close by to some of the city's main tourist attractions. That being said, the hotel didn't feel "touristy" at all. The name of the hotel comes from Emile Nelligan, a famous Quebec poet, and there are constant reminders about Ms. Nelligan throughout the hotel. Three great restaurant locations are attached to the hotel as well - Verses, Sky Terrace and Mechant Boeuf Brasserie (order the poutine!).

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roz58
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, extremely friendly and helpful staff. Great location and atmosphere. Old Montreal is fabulous. I plan to come back with my husband for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, relaxing and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Jumbolaya
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a unique hotel with loads of character to spend our honemoon. Old Monteral was our destination and after some exhaustive research online she found Hotel Nelligan. We went in with very high exopectations based on reviews both here and in Fodor's. We were not dissappointed! The room was spotless, bed was very comfortable, the electric fireplace was nice touch (although slightly tacky in a Wal-Mart kind of way) and the staff was perfect. The brick walls were amazing and mostly soundproof. Our room was looking out onto the alley and wasn't that bad. I mean really, front, back atruim or alley, all windows in Old Montreal look right at the next building anyway. The location was a 5 minute walk to the Metro and there must be 30 restaurants/coffee shops/cafes or more within that radius. We went to 4 of each during our stay and review them elsewhere. We didn't take our car out of the Valet parking for all 4 days, Nelligan is afilliated with Rainspa in Place D'Armes Hotel and they arranged for 2 spa treament there for us which were very nice. We will definitely return to Hotel Nelligan in the Ffuture and will recommend it highly to any one who asks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spacious room- go to Place d'Armes for the wine and cheese”
Reviews.Author: Laurel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rm. 303 for two nights. The room was spacious and quiet though facing the street, had a king bed, luxurious bathrobes, a fireplace you can turn on even in the summer as it throws off no heat., and jacuzzi- I gasped when my husband showed me the bathroom. It was a very comfortable room seeing as it was so muggy outside. it doesn't cost much more than an average hotel for all this elegance. You can go to the Place D'Armes, their sister hotel, for the wine and cheese reception each night- the wine is better and the presentation of the cheese, fruit and bread is much nicer; you just show your ticket. I think this would be a very nice romantic hotel for a honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: SweetieNY
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin from the momentwe arrived it was all about the service. Attentive,warm and friendly. The room was spacious and well appointed. Clean more then comfortable. The continental breakfast was well done and plentiful. I would definitely stay here again and again 5 thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MQadeer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, wonderful service, perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: janeySch
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Brilliant location near the old town centre. However we were very disappointed with the service. The maid service was slow. One day we had left the room very early and stayed out for more than 5 hours. when we returned, to get out of the blazing sun and have a rest our room had not bee made up. We asked if it could be made up and were told this would happen immediately. We waited in the bar for 30 mins and when my husband went to check if it had been done, they had not even started it. Another one hour later we were still sitting there, buying drinks from their bar ofcourse. We were just so disappointed as this was meant to be out finest hotel on our long trip. They didn't even apologize afetr the event. After checking out they didn't even ask if we had enjoyed our stay. The front of house staff were a bit rude. What a shame!!

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magique!”
Reviews.Author: henEdmonton
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 girls stayed at this beautiful hotel in Old Montreal. The staff was wonderful. The complimentary wine and cheese and breakfast were a lovely touch. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. The rooftop restaurant was fabulous as was our waiter Joe and bartender Jimmy! What a view and an outstanding burger! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A well orchestrated tourist trap...American Travellors Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aluterma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nelligan in Montreal on your recommendation. The first night there after a day of travel the hot tub kept going on and off all night. Sleep was impossible. There were no towels. Lights were burned out in the room and no one would fix them...The room could not be properly cooled. There was no manager at night and the 2 young guys who were there at just started at the place. All they could do was shrug their shoulders. The wireless internet did not work but eventually I could hook up with ethernet. The manager (Kevin) the next day got the tub fixed but not after much coaxing and that is all that was done. By the last day we got some lights fixed. The front desk girls were rude and disconnected. The adjustment on the bill was $50.00. If this is a luxury 5 star hotel you have reset the bar just above the ground. It is a tourist trap. Warn your consumers or get yourselves off the market as a service to others that will get trapped like us.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Super”
Reviews.Author: markdunn
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. We had a very large Loft room. It had a fireplace, sitting area, large bathroom and king bed. The service was spot-on. The breakfast was good. We loved the terrace. Old Montreal is the best part of the entire city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and trendy hotel in old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: swisstraveler63
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nelligan is situated right in the middle of old Montreal meaning some noise from partying people but of course the hotel is equipped with a good air-condition so it doesnâ€™t really matters. Itâ€™s conveniently located for a sightseeing trip and there are a lot of restaurants in the vicinity. There is also a restaurant called Verses in the hotel that we visited and considered as good.
